Reviews.Title: “You Only Get ONE Chance to Make a First Impression”
Reviews.Author: Willow2944
Reviews.Content: The service over the phone was deplorable. With the exception of the gentleman that answered the phone, each member of the staff that I spoke with was horribly rude. Customer service is a dying thing -- and it's completely dead at this place. I shudder at the thought of how I'll be treated upon my arrival. If a simple request for two beds rather than one King is such a hassle that causes rudeness and a complete lack of manners, what will the service be like at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay here”
Reviews.Author: SherriB1050
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here again for vacation. Another great stay. The room was a great size. Love having a coffee maker, microwave & refrigerator in the room, with Trader Joe's next door this can save you lots. The staff was always pleasant and very helpful. It is a great location just one block off the Magnificent Mile. Will always stay here for pleasure or business when in town. just great location and value for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Sue C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basic, no bar or restaurant. The rooms are basic too, though well maintained. Location is excellent. What makes this hotel extra special is the staff. Everyone has a smile on their face, everyone says hello, asks how you are, can they help, etc. Besides being so welcomed I have to admit I had 2 great nights of sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist”
Reviews.Author: Malice6
Reviews.Content: This is a basic motel setup in a good location, one block off Michigan Ave Miracle Mile. Every time we have stayed here it has been crowded with various youth groups. Noisy, rowdy youth groups. There is no restaurant so you have to walk one block to Starbucks for breakfast or next door door to a couple of mid range restaurants. It isn't cheap but this is downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: TeamTumi
Reviews.Content: During one of our frequent stays within the city we took the advice of our friends and stayed at this downtown location. This hotel is right in the midst of the notorious shopping, dinning, and entertainment area of the Loop (for tourists, that is). Don't let the mere fact of convenience of this location fool you however, as the staff is top notch and the accommodations for a pleasant nights stay did not disappoint us whatsoever. We find there is a difference between a friendly staff and those that make you feel welcomed - and the entire staff was welcoming at every level. My wife and I have made another location our "go to" hotel over the years, however this experience will make us think twice when returning knowing that we will be back again at some time.

Reviews.Title: “well... it's not expensive at least...”
Reviews.Author: fuego2u
Reviews.Content: Decent location (Few blocks off the red line) Hotel rate wasn't half bad and my room is pretty snazzy. I have a jacuzzi in the room (as in outside of the hot tub), and am located on the same floor as the pool/workout facility. cool in a kind of tacky way It's a solid not that expensive place but I had late checkout and confirmed with guest services and some floor manager jacko came pounding on my door anyway and addressed me in a pretty gruff manner. oh well. they have free wifi for me to post this review on

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: coopergoblue
Reviews.Content: Great locations, easy check-in, nice staff and comfortable room :) Would stay again, and again, and again...loved it!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Lake in the Hills, Illinois, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Nick C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located one block from the Magnificent mile which makes it perfect for being around all the great food and shopping. What really stood out about this place was the hospitality. I booked a traditional room for my wedding anniversary and had emailed the hotel for suggestions on restaurants and things to do in the area. I got a email back from the Front Desk Manager with suggestions. After a few emails back and forth and me mentioning that it was my anniversary, the manager upgraded my room to a whirlpool suite at no extra charge. Regardless if they were slow or not, I thought that was the nicest thing. She did that out of kindness which is hard to find nowadays. The room was clean and spacious. Whirlpool was nice too. Nothing can beat the location of this place, at the cost. would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, and will be staying there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fresh attitude and rooms”
Reviews.Author: barkja
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Four Points for a girls weekend. There were 4 of us sharing one double room. It was comfortable - especially the memory foam beds! Each day when we returned to the room after being out not only was the room clean but it also smelled great! The service was just fantastic. Front desk staff were helpful and friendly. The bellman was cheerful and courteous. The location is very convenient and easy to find. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Comfortable rooms! Awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Christi N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points for the first time this past weekend for a weekend of shopping and museums, we have always stayed elsewhere. We booked two rooms directly thru the hotel website and got the rooms at an extremely low price for the location, (being located one block off the mag mile). I can honestly say I was a little worried about staying here because of the low rates they were offering, to say I was pleasantly surprised is an understatement! I can't thank the staff enough, awesome job! We were continously greeted and asked if we needed anything the entire weekend. Quick check-in and out, the girls at the front desk were very efficient and able to answer all of our questions. Since we were taking the train into the city, they held our luggage till our rooms were ready and on Sunday when we checked out they held our luggage again till evening. Both rooms were nice size, very comfortable beds, and spotless, housekeeping even placed my daughters recently purchased stuffed animal on the corner of the bed so it "greeted' her when we returned. Phillip and Donte did a great job helping us everytime we were in and out with cabs, luggage, strollers, packages, directions. Both gentlemen were amazing and take customer service to the next level! Due to location we were able to walk to most of the places we were wanting to go and it was just a short cab ride to the Field Museum and Union Station. There are only three negatives I can think to say. One is the free bottled water is one per room and we had two adults and a child in each room, the second one is, one room we had was a king room with the fold out couch and there wasn't an extra blanket in the room, the third being the hot tub temperature was too hot to enjoy. These are very minor when considering how much we enjoyed our stay here. We will definitely being staying here again when we return in a couple months!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: Slimsluvbeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points over the weekend and could not have been more satisfied. Got a great last minute deal on the room rate. It was a great location with many restaurant choices and close walking to shopping and the Hancock Building. Grand Lux Cafe across the street and a great option for dining with the kids. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Economical Stay in the heart of it all!”
Reviews.Author: MemphisMomof2
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect for shopping, good restaurants, and sight seeing. Staff is courteous and friendly. Pull out sofa in room helpful is more then 4 in room. Will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: MLH91
Reviews.Content: We found a great deal for this hotel on Travelzoo and I'm so glad we did. This hotel is a hidden treasure. The price was right, the rooms were clean, and the staff was so pleasant and helpful. They even gave us passes to the club we were going to one night and that alone saved us $20. Trader Joe's is so convenient and we were able to stock up the fridge in our room with breakfast food and snacks. The location is absolutely perfect too. We go to Chicago 2-3 times a year and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate rooms, terrible customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Meliss1056
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Points from February 6th through 9th 2012. My experience is based off of business travel so although the location was great, I booked the room for the added perks of breakfast and internet included in my room rate through my corporate travel company. I traveled with a colleague and her booking was supposed to be exactly the same as mine. When we checked â€“in, my reservation did not include the breakfast and my fellow travelerâ€™s reservation did. When I inquired with the Front Desk Supervisor, she offered no explanation other than, â€œyou have different room typesâ€�. I asked her the price difference with the thought that if it a reasonable amount, I would just pay the extra fee and not worry about it. But she refused to even tell me the amount. She refused to acknowledge the issue I was facing and told me that I had to speak to the Sales Manager in the morning at 9 AM. I was there for business so obviously settling an issue the following morning regarding breakfast was not appropriate. At this point, I was not so concerned with my reservation booking or issue with breakfast; I was concerned with the demeanor of the Front Desk Supervisor. I immediately called American Express Travel and had them deal with the situation on my behalf. The following morning, AMEX was able to get my issue resolved and left me a voice message explaining that I could pick up my vouchers for breakfast at the front desk. When I arrived at the front desk after working the entire day, I was told by the same Front Desk Manager that she had no idea what I was referring to. I literally had to play the voice message that was left to me by the AMEX travel agent in order for her to simply take keys out of her pocket and hand me some generic cards for breakfast. All this fuss and she had the power to make the decision from the very beginning. My entire experience at this hotel was marred by the surly attitude of this desk manager. I will never stay here again due to the poor customer service I received. If this the type of service a Manager gives Iâ€™m afraid of what a regular associate is trained to give. Please provide this individual with proper training on how to treat customers that have questions or issues. Very disappointed with this experience and I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; super staff!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTrippers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in January. The location is great, a block off Michigan Avenue, so you have great access to the "Magnificent Mile" without the noise and bustle of being right on the strip. Excellent restaurants and shopping are nearby. The room was very clean and quiet. Best of all, the staff was uniformly pleasant and competent. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fine choice in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: A98101
Reviews.Content: Late December stay, two rooms -- one king bed, one two twins plus sofabed. Staff did a nice job setting up rooms, preparing two nearby even with two different reservations. Very comfortable accomodations in a great part of Michigan Avenue. We were on a family vacation so enjoyed the convenience of the restaurants,Water Tower, Whole Foods Market, Trader Joes, etc. nearby. Never took the el, just bus and an occassional cab. For our needs this was the most ideal starwood hotel -- others are a bit off the beaten path particularly in the winter. Would stay here again for sure. Only downside was a mix up with our "late" checkout -- although granted, somehow it wasn't marked so we received an unexpected "why haven't you checked out yet" call during our last day lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of great help”
Reviews.Author: mwh31
Reviews.Content: First the location is fantastic. But what makes this hotel stand out is the staff. I arrived just as a snowstorm did. Had theater tickets. Took poor doorman took 15 minutes in 7 degree snow storm to find us a cab. They were able to find the restaurant I wanted even though I had the name wrong. They recalled our names immediately. Just a lot of little things that make a stay better. Also has nice attached breakfast/lunch restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: trx899
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel as it's location is great, inside Chicago's loop near magnificent mile and not very expensive, I knew is the economic line for Sheraton Hotels and didn't expect for a great hotel but I get really disapointed just when going inside. Unfriendly staff during the night, they don't give you any information about hotel services and the only words I get from the girl during check in were " I need a credit card", I was carrying a huge duffel and nobody offered a kart to take them to my room. They have a dark and small lobby where WIFI works, once in your room you need to work with wired connection. About rooms are not bad, you get a small fridge, microwave and coffe maker. Rooms maintenance is good, (I can't say the same about corridors maintenance, where carpet is old and dirty). In my opinion, if you' re looking just a cheap hotel it is O.K., but if you need to work in your room or if your stay is going to be longer than 2 or 3 days avoid it, for a few more bucks you' ll get a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location with kids!”
Reviews.Author: ChipotleFan
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights for a getaway weekend to Chicago. Was perfect with the kids....very close to all the big Michigan avenue stores....even in the bitter cold! Our room came with a mini fridge and a microwave which made snacking and breakfast easy. The indoor pool was great as well as a very large hot tub. Close to the red line as well. On a side note, get the city pass to do all the touristy things...well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelGuru
Reviews.Content: Every time I have a meeting in Chicago, or even outside of Chicago, I book a room at this Four Points property. The location is perfect, walking distance to several great restaurants, shopping and two blocks from a Chicago staple...Giordano's pizza. The hotel is clean, includes water, wifi and a refrigerator and the staff are friendly. I had breakfast in the hotel once, I wouldn't recommend that again. However, they are connected to a bagel shop that has a great selection of breakfast options. If you get a chance for a nice meal....David Burke steakhouse is right next door and is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Zakman65
Reviews.Content: 2 couples spent a 3day weekend visiting Chicago,with this being my 5th stay in the last 2 years downtown.AJ,Ian and the whole staff, sorry I don't have all the names,but they know who they are!! It made for a great weekend.From the early checkin to the friendly staff always ready to help,whether a corkscrew was needed,more wine glasses,directions,recommendations or discount passes to Kingston Mines,we couldn't say enough about the spectacular service!! Definitely my new favourite Chicago hotel, and most certainly will be returning as a regular.Thanks AJ and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great time again”
Reviews.Author: sunpeople1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Four Points for the past three years and every time is better than the last. Upon arrival the front desk lady, sorry I forgot her name let me know about a parking promotion they were having and it saved us $ 70.00. We had a great room and the service was perfect as always. We will be there again next christmas. It is a can't miss hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: insuranceman2428
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night to go to american girl doll store and do some shopping. The hotel is in an excellent location--1 broke from michigan ave. The room was very clean and they held our bags as would arrived early and could not check in. The front desk rep I think his name was Gomez as great. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Got a great rate on travelzoo at $89 a night

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Kartos
Reviews.Content: It is possibly the best hotel I've stayed. Excellent service and location. Great rooms and amenities. Definitely recommend staying for downtown tours.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not the best value”
Reviews.Author: Blhp68
Reviews.Content: The hotel was okay...and just okay. The location is great if you're staying downtown and planning to do a lot on foot. There are also plenty of bus lines nearby, and you're about halfway between two El stops. Both are about four blocks away. That being said, there are lots of hotels in good locations in downtown Chicago, and for the sticker price you'll pay here, you can probably get a nicer place. The staff was pretty lackluster...not very welcoming, and definitely did not give you the sense they would go at all out of their way to help you. For example, although there are valets outside, forget about getting them to help you flag a cab. And over four days I don't think I saw anyone at the front desk smile to anyone. The rooms were cramped and dated: peeling wallpaper, chipped furniture, out-dated furnishings. In general, you just may feel like you're paying for a nicer place than what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: RickInPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times over the years, and it has held up quite well. It's not brand new, but it's not old, either. It's located on Rush Street, one block from the middle of Michigan Avenue. While not the most luxurious hotel, this Four Points Sheraton is a very clean, convenient option with friendly service. The Pros: - Location. Close to all restaurants, shopping, museums and attractions. You can walk to most anything from here in a reasonable amount of time. Also, on the same block, there's a Starbucks and a Trader Joe's (quality food, great wine, low, low prices). - Close to a subway station. Coming from either O'Hare or Midway, you'll have to change trains at some point (either from the Blue or Orange line to the Red line). Once on the Red line, the hotel is about 3-4 blocks of walking distance from the Grand Red line station. - Rooms are large, clean and the beds are comfortable. Usually you can tell the wear and tear in a room first in the bathroom - grout, tile and fixtures usually take quite a beating. But in this hotel, they have managed to keep everything in tip top shape. You also will have a microwave and small refrigerator - save some money by buying snacks, water and wine at Trader Joe's! - Hotel size - it's not that big. So you can conveniently get up and down the elevators quickly, and in and out of the hotel without crowds. - Value - You can get some incredible prices at this location, especially on off weekends when there isn't a big event in town. I paid $106 a night over New Year's weekend. The Cons: - As mentioned, this isn't a luxury hotel. Furnishings are simple and modest. But they aren't worn and ugly, either. There aren't a lot of services in the hotel, no restaurant (but plenty nearby) - WiFi was a challenge on my Apple devices. I had to spend quite a bit of time on the phone with customer service to connect my devices. They admitted that they aren't configured to easily connect to iPads, iPhones and Macs. So this was kind of a pain, but we figured out a very manual fix. The bonus is that WiFi at Four Points Sheraton is FREE! - This isn't a hotel with any views. I had a view of a white wall to the condo tower next door. Overall, it you're just looking for a nice, clean place to sleep and store your stuff while you explore this great city, this is definitely an option you should consider. Especially if you can get a price below $200.

Reviews.Title: “Family affordable”
Reviews.Author: terrij22
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times, even though we are only 1 1/2 hours from Chicago. We bring Granddaughters for an American Girl weekend, and Grandsons for sports events and restaurants. Perfect location for sightseeing. It is affordable, convenient and the staff is very accommodating for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Renee R
Reviews.Content: Great Service Great Location! Was traveling with elderly parents and a 4 month old baby and the location couldn't be beat! Staff provided wonderful service and truely went out of their way to assist us!

Reviews.Title: “CUSTOMER CENTRIC, COMFORTABLE ROOM”
Reviews.Author: SMB4_1958
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple nights during a quick holiday in Chicago with my wife. Location was great, near Michigan Avenue and a short walk to Millenium Park to see "The Bean," we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to visit. The check-in process was quick and easy. It was handled professionally and we were given an upgrade to a room with a hot tub in the room. We enjoyed that! The rate we received was already a great deal that we located on the Internet. I would recommend staying at the Four Points Sheraton to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean an priced right.”
Reviews.Author: Badrock27
Reviews.Content: Very good price Rooms were very clean and bed was comfortable. Close to michigan avenue (magnificent mile shops and restaurants). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mljstravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location just off the magnificent mile and a few blocks from the river. Typical rooms for a chain hotel - generous in size but just slightly tired. For the price, location and space, this hotel is worth returning to.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Aliu66
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three night for Christmas holidays. The nice restaurents and shopping area are around the hotel. Two blocks away to Grand red line subway and one block to main bus routes. The magnificent mile is just few steps away. We are very satisfied with the great location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Downtown Home”
Reviews.Author: aprmcc
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night for my daughter's 4th birthday on Dec. 4th. We decided to take our daughter downtown for her birthday, since we lived downtown about 10 years ago. My wife wanted to stay at one of the my historic locations, and was kinda of skeptical about the Four Points especially being on Rush Street. This staff and place far exceeded are expectation, especially for the Travelzoo deal we got. The staff at the front desk was excellent upon check in. We checked in early - with no problem, and check out late the next day since we went down to Navy Pier for WinterFest. They sang to my daughter "you say its your birthday", and gave her a treat. Her eyes lit up. The room was clean and the beds were extra comfy as promoted. The hotel is in walking distance to everything within 15 minutes, Navy Pier, Block 37, Macys, American Girl, you name it. We did not get the breakfast package, but the Eleven restaurant which is connected on the first floor, was excellent a reasonably priced for downtown. I would definitely return again and again. This place is a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colinconnor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in October. We were bumped up a grade on check in which was outstanding. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable. The room was large and clean with very comfy twin double beds. After a long flight, this was beautiful. The location of the hotel was spot on. The magnificent mile is a great place to shop, but we did however, spend time over the river, again it's only a 20 minute walk to Macey's department store. This is a short write up I know, but I can honestly say both my wife and I had a lovely stay here. The pool and jacuzzi is a nice touch too. Would we stay again? Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Chicago hotel - couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: Angela S
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in Chicago, hands-down! It is a beautiful property with wonderful staff. The rooms are extremely "travel-friendly", with a microwave oven and refrigerator, so you don't have to eat out 3 meals a day, every day . . . and for when you do eat out, you can refrigerate & microwave your left-overs. Every hotel should have these!! The location is perfect!! It is a block from the magnificent mile and centrally located enough to enable you to walk to most of Chicago's attractions. And the best part of all - to me - is that some rooms have balconies, allowing for fresh air that is so horribly lacking in most city hotels! I absolutely LOVE and highly recommend this hotel, its the only place I stay whenever my travels take me to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property!”
Reviews.Author: GrammaH
Reviews.Content: I was there with a group of ladies for a Holiday outing! The property is very nice and extremely clean! The staff was wonderful and so accommodating. The location is wonderful, easy walking to everything! Bonus ... Trader Joes right next door! We had a ball!

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary in every way”
Reviews.Author: JEL-CT
Reviews.Content: Nothing to rave about or complain about. Very typical Four Points experience. Location makes it a bit tough to get a cab in the morning. Fitness center could use a bit more diversity of equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Staff.”
Reviews.Author: mspatina
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. There is a Trader Joes downstairs. The Grand Lux (a great restaurant overlooking the magnificent mile) is kitty corner from the hotel. The magnificent mile is just down the street. You can even walk to Navy Pier. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean, the bed was comfortable. Loved having a fridge and microwave without having to ask for them. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lucy1201
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for business, and thought it was a lovely hotel. The room had some extra, unexpected ammenities, such as a refrigerator and microwave - and it was a nice size. (They were able to upgrade me to a "comfy king" room, so there was a sofa and some additional workspace.) The staff was friendly and accomodating. Great location -- near Nordstroms, Bloomingdales Home, and just one block of of Michigan Avenue. And for whatever it's worth.... the adjacent bakery (E-Leaven) had the best French Macaroons I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: JR_Tackles_The_Globe
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Location can't be beat, close to shopping, Red line is a couple blocks away, and as mentioned in other reviews, Trader Joe's right around the corner for some snacks/drinks. The bed was super comfortable and pillows were nice and fluffy. Good value and wouldn't mind staying again if I'm ever in Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Melissa B
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and staff was very friendly. Parking was reasonable and close to hotel. Need a continental breakfast, but had restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: KT L
Reviews.Content: We took a quick trip to Chicago on our kid's fall break (2011) and found this Four Points almost by accident. It is in a great location - walking distance to Water Tower Place (all of Michigan Ave.), John Hancock building, etc. Our room was clean, large and even had a small refridgerator. Indoor pool and hot tub was very nice. Fitness room was basic but nice. Employees were very friendly and helpful. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: KathyP-61
Reviews.Content: Hotel almost sits directly on the Magnificent Mile. Besides shopping, anything you could possibly need is within a few blocks: Restaurants, grocery stores (Trader Joe's right around corner, Jewel/Osco a few blocks away), Walgreens, etc. They have a nice, smallish (but bigger than many I've seen) fitness center and a small but functional business center with a couple computers and a printer. Staff is friendly. Decor is dated but rooms are roomy and very clean, and beds are very comfortable. There is a doorman who can hail a cab but I didn't notice if that service is available 24/7. If not and you can't get one otherwise, just walk There is no onsite re

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel on the Magnificent mile!”
Reviews.Author: GregoryM2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location with numerous choices of places to shop and eat. The hotel staff members are excellent, friendly, and knowledgeable. The hotel is clean, and my room was perfect. There was a coffee maker, microwave, and mini refrigerator, and free bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: FFPointsRGreat
Reviews.Content: You have to take this hotel for what it is. It's in a fantastic location near the Magnificient Mile. It's a Four Points so it's a middle of the road hotel. It was only $130. Taking all that into account the hotel is a very good option. I'm not sure other places close by are worth the extra $50 or so. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There are of course tons of food options nearby so there's no need to do anything inside the hotel. Overall a very good option at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good price”
Reviews.Author: lolo1865
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect! Anything you could want to do is withing walking distance and if not it would be a short cab ride. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Italiandreamer
Reviews.Content: Like the previous reviewer said the rooms are not that freshly decorated but were clean, in good working order and comfortable. Beds were comfy, shower was powerful/plenty hot water and aircon/TV/hairdryer all worked. Laptop sized safe which was useful as well as coffee maker in room. 3 of us sharing were given a handicapped room which was very spacious. Staff very helpful and friendly. Didn't eat on-site. Hotel was chosen for location and it's only a block or so from all the main shopping area and close to diners/restaurants too, but quiet enough to get a good sleep for city centre area. Was one of the cheaper hotels offered online so overall was great value. We hired a car so used the onsite car parking and was very handy being able to access hotel from the car park elevator and to get preferential rates. We were not in the room much as always out shopping, sightseeing and eating out but every night we were able to get good nights sleep and showered, ready for heading out again. Was one of the few bathrooms we've had that didnt fill up with steam especially with 3 of us sharing so that was great for once. A bit of TLC and modernisation in the rooms and this hotel would sell itself!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms aren't great but service is”
Reviews.Author: momo303
Reviews.Content: I was definitely disappointed when I arrived to my room here at the 4points sheridan. I was in town for a 3 day conference and the Marriott was already booked up. The rooms are old and unattractive- the tables and couches look very worn and aren't comfortable. The bed, although ugly budding, was surprisingly comfortable though. The staff was nice enough to switch me to a handicapped room on another floor which was more spacious and had a nicer bathroom. It is conveniently located to michigan avenue and within walking distance to everything. There is a cute coffee/breakfast/lunch shop called eleaven on the premises which had good breakfast and good chai tea. I also dined at the on site sushi restaurant which was nice as well. For $300, I felt the room could've been nicer but as mentioned, the staff really was great! Other hotels in the area were going for $480+/night to give you a perspective The gym was nice as had everything you could need and does have an indoor pool for those who like swimming or have kids

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but no frills.”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, right in the middle of Mag Mile, with plenty of restaurants and shopping within a 5-block radius. Rooms are very clean but decor is spartan; it's a very generic mid-scale hotel feel, with nothing "special" or memorable about it. Beds are the great redeemer here--- very comfortable, and among the best hotel beds I've slept in. Wi-fi was free for all guests but quite slow; I'd gladly have paid more for faster wi-fi; the check-in experience was poor, with only one employee working at about 6:30pm on a weeknight, so there was quite a line ahead of us. While that one employee was helpful and friendly, it took a very long time to get to the front of the queue. Knowing that the quality of sleep counts more heavily, that helps raise the overall rating of the hotel; however, the high price tag (in line with many neighboring Mag Mile hotels that featured more amenities) I am not sure that I'd return.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel, in the center of it all!”
Reviews.Author: FLORIDABRUCE
Reviews.Content: In Chicago on business, but also to visit family. Picked this hotel because of its location, and found it to be perfect. Check in was fast, the staff friendly and fun. The room was great, well-appointed and very clean, great service here as well. Chicago is not a cheap hotel city, this was good value a block off Michigan, 2 short blocks to Quartinoâ€™s (review under restaurants), Pizza Duo across the street. I would just avoid the Eleven restaurant on the ground floor. Not affiliated with the hotel, I do not believe. Go to Quartinoâ€™s and Shawâ€™s Crab house for real treats!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whatremains
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here because of a good deal we came across. We have stayed in a variety of Starwood properties around the world and thought this was a clean hotel with no frills. The staff are friendly and the rooms are ok. Could use some updates but overall an ok stay. The location is great if you are looking to be close to the shops but a bit far from some of the major sites. Also be ready to pay a hefty price for parking. Would recommend this hotel if you are looking for the basics.

Reviews.Title: “1st Time Visitor to Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: NJP_11
Reviews.Content: My husband & I foundFour Points Sheraton to be centrally located to the fantastic bus transportation to museums, parks, restaurants & shopping plus easy walking from hotel to various locations -- Lake Michigan, Navy Pier, and Water Tower areas. The free wifi and business center was appreciated especially for boarding pass printing and looking up info for museum hours and various schedules for transportation. The staff was extremely helpful for directions and always having a smile & a hello greeting. The microwave & refrigerator was helpful in keeping beverages cool for our enjoyment. The room was spacious and comfortable w/a couch, chair, desk and a very comfortable King-Size bed!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have had a better experience staying in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Discotish
Reviews.Content: This past weekend was the second time I've had the pleasure of staying at the Four Points Sheraton Downtown and without a doubt, it's been one of the best hotel experiences I've had. The Four Points is not a luxury hotel, but it is very nice and to be honest, one of the things about the Four Points that makes it so great are the employees. I've been fortunate to travel all over and very rarely have I encountered hotel staff that is so friendly and willing to go the extra mile for their guests. I was with a large group of women on a weekend getaway and without the assistance of the Yolanda and Lana helping us with our group arrangements, as well as the doormen (both are SO nice!!) the check in staff and the hard working housekeepers, our weekend trip would have been much more stressful. The location of the Four Points is fantastic and is very close in proximity to the Magnificent Mile, world class shopping and dining and excellent sightseeing. Reasonably priced with nice rooms and some of the most comfortable hotel beds EVER, make this a top notch hotel in my book. They have a nice indoor pool and hot tub, as well as a nice outside patio on the 5th floor, too! I can't wait to return for my trip next year. Trust me on this one, you can't beat the Four Points by Sheraton when it comes to price, comfort and location!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Gillybeane
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here on 2 separate occasions, with a large group both times. The rooms are very comfortable and clean, the location is fabulous, and the staff are beyond fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: lindas0809
Reviews.Content: I have been part of a large group that has stayed here for two years in a row. I have been very impressed with the service and condition of the hotel. The staff is wonderful and extremely helpful. It is unusual to get service like this anywhere. The location is great - most of the tourist attractions are within walking distance. I would recommend Four Points to anyone going to Chicago! I would love it if they had an airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “The second time around here...”
Reviews.Author: ChipNovaMac
Reviews.Content: The drabness of the rooms hasn't changed much - but the staff is is more lively and friendly. For the location to the Magnificent Mile; tho place can't be beat. Walking, busses, and the L can't be beat...

Reviews.Title: “Best conceirge's in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: maria p
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay, great room and the hot tub was wonderful after a day of walking. The conceigre's were the best!!!!! We found some wonderful places to eat and sights to see thanks to them. Over all a great experience and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel in a Great City!”
Reviews.Author: jeff o
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a few days off together so we decided to spend the time in Chicago. Looking at the hotel options on Tripadvisor and deciding on what part of town we wanted to stay in, we narrowed it down to a few hotels based on location and price. We were able to book a room on the hotel website with a promotion rate of about $125 a night. The location was excellent being right off the Magnificent Mile on Rush St. with lots of restaurants and shops within the neighborhood. Parking was $40 a night but in Chicago that is a good price. The room itself was nothing special but was acceptable. We would stay there again. One dining tip.. Avoid Pizza Uno down the street. There are too many good restaurants in Chicago to submit yourself to that disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls' Weekend”
Reviews.Author: HB952
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a girls' weekend getaway as it has a great location, comfy beds, big rooms, and a refrigerator. It is close to Michigan Avenue and the Chicago River. Easily walkable to many restaurants and sites. The room was clean, although did have a bit of dust around the outlets and baseboards, but nothing terrible. The rooms are nice, but not exactly overly-fancy. Very friendly and helpful front desk staff, too. We took the blue line in from O'Hare to Lake/Clark station and then cabbed it from there ($10). You could take a bus from Lake/Clark, but the cab was fine for us. Good, quick breakfast spot downstairs - e'Leaven.

Reviews.Title: “A magnificent hotel on the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: AldenS19
Reviews.Content: Four Points is located in an ideal place to visit Magnificent Mile area of Chicago. It's next door to a Trader Joe's, where you can pick up snack items for your room, and is within easy walking distance of several good restaurants. The hotel staff was very helpful with information on visiting the area. The room was very clean, well appointed, and roomy. Business center was available 24/7, so checking e-mail and Facebook was easy (left the laptop at home). The exercise room was also available 24/7, and had plenty of workout machines. When we noticed some drilling noises late at night and early in the morning, the front desk staff was able to find out the source and update us on the issue satisfactorily. We had a very nice stay at the Four Points and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: abmartin71
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for a "girls' weekend" and had a great time. The price was right and the location perfect. The free internet was a bonus and the room was well sized and very clean. I would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice property at an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: dramesh
Reviews.Content: Saying "a great stay for the price" sounds like damning with faint praise, but when you're talking about downtown Chicago, I could have easily spent two to three times what we did and not gotten a better experience. The location is perfect, just a block off of Michigan, right around the corner from a number of excellent restaurants, and within walking distance of everything central and north. The room was spacious, clean and quiet, the elevators were pretty fast, and the pool and rooftop sitting area were nice. I'm not sure I understand the "top pool in Chicago" rating - it's a little wading pool that only goes to three and a half feet. It's pretty, but I guess we had hoped for a little bit more. There is a hot tub and exercise area also... Two minor issues - when we checked in, we were told that the room wasn't ready yet (darn that time change - we were an hour early!) so we had a bellcap take our luggage and walked a block to Uno's and had some amazing Chicago pizza. 75 minutes later we returned to find that our room still wasn't ready. Twenty minutes later, a frustrated check-in staff member called her boss over and they seemed to work something out - we got out room keys and went up. The bellhop was fantastic - coming up moments later and giving us a broad view of what was in the area and when to see. We were left to sleep in bliss on their comfortable beds for each of the four nights we were there, until the morning we were to depart. At 7:30 in the morning(!) we have housekeeping knocking on the door. A warning: Put the DO NOT DISTURB sign on your door the last day you're here. We acquired a do not disturb sign and put it on the door. It must have fallen off because 45 minutes later we have a rather rude housekeeper banging again, "You ARE leaving today, right?" Parking is a mixed bag - the lot is attached to the hotel and is uber-expensive ($50 a night) but you have in and out, so if you're going to use the car, it may end up being a bargain. Otherwise, I highly recommend checking http://chicago.bestparking.com/ for lots that are a block or two away if you're leaving the car untouched for more than 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 1970amy1970
Reviews.Content: When we walked in the reception area was a bit cold....personality not weather....but once we checked in we were treated very nicely. We asked for extra cups/towels etc and they were there when we returned. The conceigre's were AMAZING! Offering us great tips on local eateries, we were treated excellently by them. The rooms are large for Chicago, the pool/hottub are clean and in a great location. would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Easy to get to and from”
Reviews.Author: HadenHome
Reviews.Content: We took a trip to Chicago in May of 2011 to visit sites of family past and to have adventures new. This hotel was very nice. The employees were kind and attentive and the rooms were clean and tastefully decorated. Our room had a big window, a seating area, a small kitchenette area with microwave and fridge and a desk and two beds. Plenty of room for the tow of us. The location was excellent. We were within walking distance of several bus stops and were able to get anywhere we needed to from our central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - convenient”
Reviews.Author: tcolussi
Reviews.Content: This was a really great place to stay as it is really close to great shopping on Michigan Avenue. I spent three days in Chicago, staying at Four Points and never once got a cab. I went to many restaurants within walking distance, entertainment and shopping. It was a great trip. We booked our trip through Hotels.com and for some reason our reservation didn't give us the two double beds we asked for. When we arrived, they only had Kings with a pullout couch left. They gave us free parking because of the inconvenience. Very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, all around”
Reviews.Author: Lashlarue12
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and the staff were very friendly, one of the cleaning staff offered me two bottles of water stating that "it was hot outside today youmay these".

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great location, amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherA811
Reviews.Content: We were right on the river with a view of the lake. It was perfect. The hotel was very nice, and our room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: happytravels1234
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in lots of hotels near Michigan Avenue. This is our favorite so far. You cannot beat the location. The front desk staff is very nice and helpful. Our room was clean and the maid service was good. Each room has a small refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot. These were nice "extras" you don't normally find in hotels in this area. The wireless internet did not work (even after I called tech support). I used one of the two computers in the complimentary business center and finished up what I needed to do online. Everything else was A+. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Choose this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Syraruns
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and very friendly staff, worth the price! Location is perfect; having Trader Joes and Starbucks next door is convenient. Rooms are clean, I like this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel we will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: kristabill
Reviews.Content: This is close to everything, staff was welcoming and accomodating. Could not ask for a better place!

Reviews.Title: “Best I had in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: pokeymail
Reviews.Content: Simple: Stay here! Love the Intercontinental on Michigan, Swissotel, W, etc but here are some things to factor in. Free wifi in room ($15/day elsewhere), two free bottles of water in the room (what, not $2 each?), mini fridge, microwave. Continental breakfast. VERY friendly staff. Flat screen, comfortable bed, clean. Yes, location is awesome. Trader Joes for groceries below. This is now the only hotel I will stay at in Chicago. And although I didn't take advantage of it, I did see that there were package deals where you added parking to the price and it increased the price by only $20. That's $50 at pretty much every hotel in downtown Chicago. Last I looked, 4.6 out of 5 AVERAGE rating for this hotel which, if you take the top five, five star ratings and took the bottom five 1 stars, this hotel would be close to perfect on the scale. So I paid $200 a night right? Nope, $115 on Expedia. Unbelievable value. So as I said: STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Soxfan46
Reviews.Content: We had a nieces wedding to go to on Labor Day weekend. The wedding was at Southshore Country Club but my niece got a block of rooms at this hotel for 99 bucks a night. I think this was a great deal for a very clean hotel in the heart of downtown. This is actually are second time staying here and both times it was for weddings. The girl at check in was nice she upgraded our room to one with a sleeper couch without me asking. This was great, my kids slept on the couch and we got the bed. Unfortunately I had to work early the next morning but the Red line is only a couple blocks away. My wife and kids used the pool the next day and they enjoyed it. Overall I would say this place is a clean, solid place that is not to fancy.

Reviews.Title: “You will like it! It have all you need.”
Reviews.Author: LESMEX
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel, nice rooms, plasma TV, refrigerator, microwave, Gym, pool, big rooms... All you need.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: 50 states before I die
Reviews.Content: Super location for shopping (2 blocks) eating (2 blocks) and even the subway (5 blocks). Large comfortable rooms with fridge, microwave, free water, iron board, safe, and everything else you may need. Pillows were too soft, but they replaced them without any problems. I had to call security on the room next to me which was drinking, listening to loud music, yelling, etc. well after 10pm. They took care of that as well, but it took almost 1 hour for the room to quiet down enough for my kids to sleep. I will be back-everyone was so kind!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: crew347
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overall very good. Great location in the center of the touristic attractions of River North. Room was very clean with comfy beds, decent air conditioning. Staff was very nice and helpful. Very small lobby, valet parking service (that I did not use). Mini fridge in the room and Trader Joe's downstairs. Next door to the CTA's red line making it convenient to ride to Ohare or Midway. Would definitely comeback.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - awesome location ....”
Reviews.Author: Budweege
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean hotel with a great location... The staff was great and we couldn't have asked for a better trip! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to get to and from the interstate. A few of us walked to the Magnificent Mile from the hotel. Rooms were very clean and seemed up to date. The wine list in the restaurant was decent and complimented dinner nicely. With a lot of choices within walking distance we only dined in house for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: capegirardeau
Reviews.Content: Not fancy, but friendly and functional. Wonderful location a short block from the Magnificent Mile and as a driver, I appreciated the very easy route from and to the Interstate.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not at that price”
Reviews.Author: ThorsMomma
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay was approximately $250 per night. Which was the going rate for any of the hotels that weekend. It was an okay hotel but not for that price. The pool had to shut down because someone threw up ..... not that they can help that, but we were expecting to keep our 9 year old happy by using the pool. The front staff was exceptional. They got us checked in early. The concierge's were spectacular. Even working extra to get us a "ecologically friendly" taxi cab at my son's request. No in hotel dining room and so we had to order in from a nearby restaurant. The biggest "whine" is that the very next week they were offering the same hotel rooms for almost half the price. I never did find out why that weekend was so booked .... but the room would have been great at the lesser deal. Also, we asked for bedding for the sleeper sofa. Had to call twice ... but those things happen.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: ndlxs
Reviews.Content: A good, convenient hotel in the Miracle Mile, close to the Red Line and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Gruber03
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels downtown. It is in a great location, one block from tons of shopping on Michigan Ave, attached to a Starbucks, etc. They had a free business center, free gym, and a free pool. The rooms were spacious and Very clean. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One Night Here Was Enough, Especially at that Price”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: I moved to this hotel for the last night of my work stay as prices at the W skyrocketed. It has a decent enough location, but i think I'll opt for one of the other Starwood's in the future. I arrived around 9:30pm, apparently right after a tour bus had dropped off an entire load of people and when I asked if they have a starwood preferred counter, the said no. They had 2 people checking people in and it took about 20 minutes until I was helped. I had had my wallet stolen on a previous flight so my husband had called with his credit card and asked them to charge that. Well that turned out to be a disaster and took multiple phone calls, including to my credit card company (the hotel said it wasn't going through) to get everything straightened out but finally it was. The room is not what i am used to at other Starwood. The bed was comfortable enough, but bedding is not as high quality. The bathroom especially lacks and the room itself is much smaller than other starwoods. I'm Platinum at starwood and I don't think there are room upgrades at Four Points. Also, often breakfast is included at sheraton's, but it wasn't here. It was a complete joke that the price was close to $300. You could really tell a difference between the staff here versus at other Starwoods. The level of service and professionalism just isn't there. I would say this is a fine option, but only if you get a much better deal than I got.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: MaryG_from_Toronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days to scope out whether we wanted to move to the city, and the location is fabulous! It is one block away from Michigan Avenue and walking distance to several Chicago institutions like The Magnificent Mile, deep dish pizza restaurants, Portillo's, the Rock and Roll McDonalds, the watertower, American Girl Place, Navy Pier, the Hancock Tower, and department stores. The staff recommended the Grand Luxe Cafe which we head to every time we are in town. The hotel was clean, no noise, fantastic staff. We got a great deal on one of those hotel sites. Fantastic, go here and you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - great location”
Reviews.Author: bobber73
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of this hotel after a 3 night break. Lovely welcome when we arrived and we had a double comfy room which was large and well equipped. Large flat screen TV, a good hairdryer and good lighting. First night we were in a room and I could not sleep well as I was conscious of the noise from the ventilation system ( not sure if this was because of jet lag that I was sensitive to the noise) but when I went to the front desk at 6am Rachel and the night porter couldn't have been more helpful. The hotel was full but they arranged for a room change and for my bags to be looked after until the room was ready. Overall a good experience and lovely front of house staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rate, staff, service. Excellent experience, have already been talking you guys up.”
Reviews.Author: danovak
Reviews.Content: Recommended highly. All comments on similar reviews here are accurate, as we were happy to learn.

Reviews.Title: “Great chicago hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Zan11
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel and were treated well from the start. The bellhop, phillip was helpful and kind. He catered to our EVERY need! It is nice inside the lobby with free candies and cucumber water. Gomez at the front desk was nice. We were plesantly surprised to find out, since we are platinum members of Starwood Preferred Guests our rooms were on a private floor!!!! It is at the top floor so it has the best view. It was a simple but well furnished room with two double beds and a pullout. There was an HD TV. The location was great, at magnificent mile. overall this was a freat hotel that i'd recommend!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Martinigirl45
Reviews.Content: I am late in writing this...but this hotel ROCKS!! I have stayed here before and this is my go to hotel when I visit the windy city. The staff is amazing, each and every time. I have pd reduced rates, and SPG rates...always worth it. The location can not be beat. All rooms have a fridge and microwave, and with Trader Joes a block away...perfect. Michigan ave is one block away with all it has to offer. Great restaurants in walking distance, Art Institute is walkable, The beds are amazing, large flat screen tvs, and a pool!! Free Wi-Fi without a glitch....take note hotels that charge for wi-Fi...it is so wrong! So in a nut shell...Amazing hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ndfor22349
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my brother when in town to see U2. convienant location and a very nice hotel. The staff was great from the door man to the cleaning crew. The front desk staf were very nice especially trying to get us checked in as soon a possible. would stay again .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: PattiBruno
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location very close to the magnificent mile, nearby restaurants and many Chicago attractions. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms are spacious and very clean with a refrigerator and microwave. I would highly recommend this hotel to all. We truly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: travelgs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Four Points, Chicago for 3 days. The hotel is in a perfect location, right between the Navy Pier and Michigan Avenue. We took the train and we waliked from the train station to the hotel. It took us about 35 or 40 minutes, but we got to do some sight seeing along the way. Check in was fast, the girl at the desk was very friendly and efficient. She gave us a room on the 31st floor, looking out over the river winding between the buildings. It was an awesome view. Very nice corner room, coffee maker, mini bar, etc. We had a king sized bed and it was very comfy. We joined the Starwood hotels preferred guest program and had free continental breakfast every day. It was served on the 33rd floor in a very nice little lounge. Nice spot for a quiet breakfast. We didn't eat at the restaurants in the hotel since there are so many dining options in Chicago, so I can't comment on those. My husband was looking to purchase some cigars, so we asked the concierge where to go. He recommended a place for us. He was very helpful and knew alot about the city. Overall, I would say that this is a good hotel in a perfect location. Staff is friendly, rooms are very clean and the price was right, too. I would definitely stay here again when I return to chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A good clean place to stay. Located conveniently to many restaurants and shopping locations.”
Reviews.Author: Bill G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my grandson for several days. We purchased CTA bus passes for three days which cost $14.00 each. We were able to walk one block to Michigan Avenue and catch a city bus to all the locations we wanted to visit. There is a nice pool at the hotel and a convenient snack bar. We had breakfast at the snack bar each morning. I found the snack bar prices to be reasonable. The hotel does have parking attached, we did not use the parking. There are many restaurants located within a two block area. We took the "Gangster Tour" and only had to walk a couple of blocks to connect with the tour. Our room had a microwave and fridge. Each day we received a comp bottle of water. As mentioned before, Michigan Avenue is only one block away. All the shopping you could want is located along Michigan Avenue. You receive a comp USA Today each morning delivered to your door. There is a small gift shop in the lobby with some food items. I thought the price was high, but, most hotels in the River North area are expensive, IMO. I saw many business and airline people staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A thoroughly middle-of-the-road experience.”
Reviews.Author: highlanderfil
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Points during the weekend of the Manchester United - Chicago Fire match. The pricing wouldn't be relevant because I used my American Airlines points for the two days in lieu of money, but it probably came out to something like $140/day. Let's just say I won't be back to this hotel if I have to pay actual money for it. Even in Downtown Chicago in what is a very nice neighborhood, there are bound to be better options - especially on Priceline. That is not to say my experience was terrible. The amenities were nice and clean, the bed was extremely comfortable and the fact that the TV was a 40-or-so-inch LG flat-screen was a very welcome touch. However, since Four Points subscribes to DirecTV, the storm that came through that night made it quite useless apart from the absolutely ridiculously-priced Pay-Per-View movies ($16 to watch "Fast Five"? I can buy the DVD for less). Wi-Fi is free, but the reception was far from ideal as I had to call downstairs to have them reset the router. I took the train, but the parking is about what you'd expect - $35/night if memory serves. Where the hotel really came up short is the service. Granted, I arrived around midnight, but it took about half an hour to finally figure out my reservation, "unblock" my room and at the end of it all I ended up all the way at the end of a one-way corridor, making my room the farthest away from the elevator. Not the most convenient of locations nor the warmest of receptions. The cleaning crew also decided it was a good idea to knock on my door despite the "Do Not Disturb" placard which is completely unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: calbear93
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a fabulous location -- easy walk to the Water Tower, shops and restaurants on/around Michigan Ave. Starbucks around the corner and Trader Joe's downstairs made stocking drinks and snacks in fridge in room a breeze. The "extra comfy" room with 2 doubles and sitting area fit our family of 4 easily. Free WiFi and bottled water were nice perks as well. Hotel also has a heated indoor pool and fitness room but we didn't use during our 4 night stay since we were out and about most of the time. Staff was friendly and helpful (e.g called to make sure requests were fulfilled, accommodated an early check in and fairly late check out). Room could use updating and walls were not sound proof but manageable noise level. Overall great for our trip for a family reunion, wedding, and taking in Chicago. around the corner, Trader Joe's downstairs

Reviews.Title: “overbooked”
Reviews.Author: nathanwaks
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately our only experience here was a disaster as they were overbooked, despite having received a confirmation only a few days earlier. they tried to have us stay 30 miles out of town, but fortunately Hotels.com managed a better arrangement. Front office was courteous but ultimately unhelpful. I have received an apology from the hotel, but nothing from Sheraton to try and make us feel better about choosing them (Sheraton) in future. we travel a lot so not good PR I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, cheerful staff”
Reviews.Author: WhitefishBay
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a girls weekend in Chicago. Had a wonderful stay at the Four Points Sheraton. The hotel is in a prime location - walking distance to Michigan Ave., among other things. We were there for dinner, a show, and nightlife, so didn't spend a lot of time walking around. The hotel itself is great. The woman who checked me in was extremely pleasant and helpful. It was quite hot on this particular day, and the cucumber infused water in the lobby was a nice, refreshing treat. We were a part of four and had a room with two queen beds and a pull-out, a microwave and mini fridge. Room was clean. Incredibly comfy beds/pillows. Spacious enough for the four of us, though we hardly spent any time in the room, except to sleep. The halls were nice and quiet, which was nice after a long day/night. Upon check-in, we received a $13 gift card for Eleven, a cafe around the corner. Although we ate breakfast at the Grand Luxe Cafe (yuM!), did stop in the cafe and grabbed a dozen bagels for the road. Had it not been for the GLC being so close and too good to pass up, we would have grabbed a nice breakfast at Eleven w/ the gift card. Also, there is an indoor pool, although my group didn't take advantage of this, it is a nice amenity. I received a special corporate rate for the hotel, so we paid $149 for the room plus $40 for each car (we had 3 cars total). There is a parking garage attached to the hotel, which is very convenient. I just saw a Travel Zoo special for this hotel today for select dates @ $119/night or $140/night with parking. I feel like there are a lot of good deals to be had. Will definitely consider this hotel again for my next stay in Chicago. Can't be the location, and the atmosphere is quite nice. Staff great too. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago is a great city and the Four Points is a great location.”
Reviews.Author: AJC1968
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and comfortable. Great stay for the price. It is only a block from the Mile and very close to all of the restaurants and night life on State street. My wife and I really loved the city and part of our great stay was the hotel. As an added bonus we met Henry Winkler at the SBucks down stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelissaKK22
Reviews.Content: I am greatly disappointed in my stay and even more disappointed in their responses to my concerns. I booked a weekend trip to Four Points by Sheraton Chicago Downtown on North Rush Street. It is a great location, but there are many hotels in the area. When looking to book, I called to ask about the use 1000 Star points and get Â½ off. I was booking for 2 nights and the going rate online was around $189 per night at this hotel. When I called, I was told it would be less than $180, and I even asked to clarify if that was both nights, and confirmed it was. I also questioned that it was only 1000 points, and told that it was. I was very excited, and my friend and I booked our flights later that week. Had I been told the hotel would be $177.50+tax PER NIGHT, we would not have booked flights. I went back through my spam filter and did find a confirmation email, and at the very bottom it says $177.50 per night, and shame on me for trusting a person and not reading my email. I think it is very misleading when discussing travel to not quote the total. I called the SPG customer service line after we got the bill from the hotel to discuss this, and was told it would be researched and I would be called back within 72hours. Itâ€™s been 4 days, and no one has called me back. I would have at least appreciated a call back that my concerns had been heard. During our stay, we had MANY issues. We got to the hotel before noon, and our room wasnâ€™t ready, as I expected. We checked our bags and got 5 claim tickets. When we returned to the hotel in the afternoon to check in, I counted the 5 tickets and handed them over. We were brought some but not all. We eventually got all, but the clerk claimed I had only handed him 4 tickets. I insisted, and he did go and came back with the 5th (a laptop bag), but did not even hint at apologizing for the hassle. We got up to the room, and went out for the night. When we got back, my friend jumped in the shower and came back out saying it wouldnâ€™t drain. I also took a shower without it draining, and I attempted to flush the toilet, which would not flush. We called down and they sent a man up to the room at around 12:30am. When I opened the door, he asked if I was going to plunge the toilet, and was annoyed when I said no. He wasn't able to do the shower. In the morning, the toilet was still iffy, so we used the lobby bathroom and told the front desk on our way out. When we came back that night, the drain was put back and the shower worked, so we knew someone had been there and assumed all was fixed. My friend got up in the night, and without using the toilet attempted to flush it and it didnâ€™t work. She went to the lobby in her pajamas. I went back to the front desk in the morning, and we were checking out. I expressed my frustration to the front desk that we had to come down to the lobby bathroom, and she only questioned why I didnâ€™t call them back up again in the middle of the night. No apologies. I had spent over 30 minutes on the phone about the billing already that morning, so it wasnâ€™t surprising to me that there was no customer care. I left the hotel at the point of tears I was so frustrated. We had a great time in Chicago, but this was a horrible hotel. And certainly not worth $400 for 2 nights. We went over to the Hyatt for 3 nights for business. We blew the fuse to our room having two hair dryers going at the same time, which was our fault. They sent a friendly man up immediately that corrected the problem. The front desk called to check with 30 minutes to make sure we were taken care of. They also sent an apology letter with a coupon for a free bakery item, free parking or drink in the hotel, which was completely above and beyond as the issue was our fault. The entire experience at the hotel was great. Friendly service, friendly people, and for about the same price as the Four Points. Our toilet even worked in the room without the embarrassment of walking into the lobby in pajamas. There are other options, and I would check those out.

Reviews.Title: “girls weekend! we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Canada_11
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. This hotel is located 1 block from michigan ave (magnificent mile) and within walking distance from many attractions. Chicago is a great city and this is a great hotel!! the staff was nothing but friendly, helpful and courteous! thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Magnificient Mile Value”
Reviews.Author: NeverHomeInLA
Reviews.Content: Located one block off Michigan Avenue, this property is ideally located and one of the more reasonably priced hotels in downtown Chicago. It is simple and that's why! Very comfortable, front desk personnel are delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel and Good Location, but a Little Shady”
Reviews.Author: ruby_soulsinger
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was comfortable and clean, and the location was excellent for access to the Magnificent Mile, shopping, dining, etc. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. HOWEVER, there was a bit of "shadiness" at check-in. I had reserved a room for 3 adults via Hotwire.com (and had therefore already been charged for it). When I checked in, I was told we had been given a room with one king bed. I'm not really sure how they expected 3 non-related adults to comfortably sleep in 1 king bed, but they told me that I could "upgrade" to a room with 2 doubles and a sofabed for an additional $40. Since I had no other option, I went ahead and upgraded. Ridiculous! I complained to hotwire.com and received a credit to my account, but never heard anything back from the Four Points by Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LyndaMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points in July and we thought the room was a little 'tired'. The lobby is 'no big deal' and the rooms were renovated, yet still looked like they needed more work. There were stains on the bedspread and the ottoman and the room, in general, looked a bit worn. We were on the 6th floor and had to insert our keycard into the elevator every time we wanted to go to our floor. The people on the floors lower than the 6th didn't need to do this. This is a BIG hassle!! Ask to be on a floor lower than 6. (There are about 8 floors total.) The walls were super thin and we could hear normal conversation from the people next door to us. There was only ONE regular coffee and one decaf available. Why not leave two of each in each room? My husband and I had to play 'Rock, Paper, Scissors' to see who was going to get the regular coffee. But, since the location is so good (lots of restaurants, the subway, Trader Joe's and shopping nearby) I would recommend this hotel in spite of the thin walls. Just bring earplugs and some caffeine for morning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: JackAndJohn
Reviews.Content: Very nice and new, clean, quiet, and easy access to North Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Part II -- Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Rooms -- Thank You!”
Reviews.Author: FairmindedTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was so excited that I had an opportunity to stay here again (see my previous review) that, honestly, the hotel's availability at a great price via a travel site was the determining factor in me booking a Denver-to-Chicago Easter weekend trip. Vegas was on the radar, as well as other places, or just staying home. The wonderful folks here did not disappoint! Originally booked my flight to arrive late on a Friday night and, knowing how the hotel might be busy then, I emailed Mary Orlando (the hotel's GM who often interacts with TA guests) to alert. Also as I was staying for 4 nights, I wanted to see if a king-bed room on a higher floor (quieter) might be available...if not, I totally understand during a holiday weekend. Mary was very gracious and gave me a wonderful room beyond my expectations; the late checkin was moot as my airline opened up earlier flights the day before. New info about the rooms: this hotel truly thinks about everything logistically regarding guests' comfort in an uncomplicated way -- and it's not just an advertising saying. Yes the fridge, microwave, and free water are really great touches. But even how the proximity of the wall plugs and the way they're pointed (for a guest with multiple electronic devices like cell phone, computer, camera charger etc) you can tell has been thought out to every last detail (I just stayed in a 4-star hotel a couple weeks ago and no plugs were available by the bed). Regarding everything else, the bed was exceptionally comfy (while I was there, beds were being replaced, which says how serious the hotel is about keeping the extra comfort that way). The bathroom was well-appointed, the shower had great pressure (again, there's that comfort theme in reality). Loved the great in-room wifi and also the biz center (for printer boarding passes, restaurant info, transit schedules). My other review details my love for this great hotel, I dunno what more I can say! As far as the staff, on a scale from 1 to 10, they're probably approaching the "20" mark, let's put it that way. Ms. Orlando, i really appreciate your extra and gracious efforts in assuring that I'd have a comfy room even if I checked in late on a holiday weekend -- thank you so much. When I bumped into the "Amazing Phillip," the hotel's long-time doorman who is known for his extraordinary efforts on behalf of guests, he was so gracious. I was just saying "hey" as I had met him in 2010 and he asked if I had written a really nice TA review that mentioned him by name -- and he expressed his appreciation (Phillip, trust me, I think when people do good or great as in your case, I think we sometimes take that for granted and don't praise enough). The front desk deserves accolades as well. Just very pleasant, very friendly (I observed some fellow guests who weren't so pleasant and the front desk folks were so gracious). Also very responsive -- I noticed a young child (maybe 10 years old) unsupervised in the biz center and alerted them and they immediately took action. My only "glitch" occurred because my neighboring guests decided that, once bar time ended, karaoke time could begin at 430 a.m. As someone who hates to call the front desk and complain about frivolous things, I did call (couldnt sleep) and Jeremy had things taken care of within 5 minutes. Kudos Jeremy! And finally, three words: location, location, location (I mean, what's not in a 2-3-block radius?!). It cannot be beat for any traveler type regarding Chicago. You will never go wrong staying at this wonderful hotel. Thanks, Mary, Phillip, Jeremy, and colleagues, you rock!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: cubs-rock-355
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! They had a nice pool and good service! It was in a very good location and it was easy for us to walk to american girl doll store for the young ones. Then we just walked a few steps to cheese cake factory (BTW i reccomend the reastoraunt)

Reviews.Title: “parking fee is major rip off”
Reviews.Author: Lee068
Reviews.Content: this hotel parking garage has a posted overnight fee of $16.00, however, the Sheraton charges $40,00. Unknowing guests are ripped off. Next time we will be "public" Parkersburg.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place downtown”
Reviews.Author: j75fr
Reviews.Content: Fast check in Rooms are good and clean Location could not be better Rooms with balcony available Nice pool Small fitness Free Internet

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location!”
Reviews.Author: travelin4us30
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Starwood properties from a luxury collection hotel to their lower end Four Points hotels and those in between. This Four Points in Chicago has older rooms and a small lobby, but it provides the same great service that you receive in all Starwood properties. It is very clean, has wonderful friendly staff, and the location is perfect for your visit to Chicago. The beds are very comfortable so you get a good nights sleep. I would recommend this hotel for those looking for a nice clean hotel at a good price. If you are looking for a more impressive lobby with a beautiful pool for the kids then consider somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the middle of EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: playmaker16
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had tickets to the Cubs vs. Sox game at the beginning of the month and we decided to stay the night in the city to complete our date. This hotel was great. We took the train down to Chicago and arrived in the city around 10:30am. Around 11, we arrived at the hotel and the front desk was nice enough to let us check in...4 HOURS EARLY! The 12pm checkout was nice too the following day because it meant that we didn't have to race to get out of there. Anyhow, after the game we made it back to the hotel and walked right around the corner to The Weber Grill. But believe me, you have plenty of other options if steaks aren't your thing. You're located right off of Michigan Ave and centered around so much food and nightlife. The actual room was really nice too. It got cool with good AC during a hot July evening. The bed was particularly comfortable and we sunk right into our pillows. The price was reasonable for the time of year and it really was a great hotel that my wife and I would stay at again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pcwd630
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at the hotel and were very impressed. All staff we encountered was very friendly and professional, ranging from bell hops to front desk to housekeeping.
