The room was clean and well appointed - the fridge and microwave were very helpful. We had one very minor repair issue and it was resolved very promptly, and our other special requests were also handled well. The pool and the sitting area adjacent to the pool were both great. Location is perfect - right in the middle of everything, and the Trader Joe's next door allows you to stock up on anything you might need. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel and will likely stay there on my next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location & wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: ChristineDB
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Chicago Sat - they had trouble finding my reservation at first. The manager AJ, was wonderful & upgraded our room & apologized for the delay. The bellman, was friendly, helpful. Location is great with a Trader Joe's around the corner, & Starbucks. Literally minutes from Michigan Ave., I would definitely stay again if I could get the same price I initially purchased from priceline. Thumbs up to the staff for making our trip so great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you get the right price”
Reviews.Author: mytravels234
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a group while in town for some baseball games and fun. We had a deep group discount rate. Based on the low rate I paid, I thought the hotel was awesome. I'm not sure I'd pay full price for what you get here compared to other places nearby. When booking in the Chicago loop area I usually search for deep discounts on Hotwire or similar deals because I can find them for 50% off and it's pricey in that area. I found the hotel rooms were standard and what you would expect at most hotels like this one. Beds were okay, not bad and nothing special. The best thing about this hotel is the location on Rush street only a couple blocks from Michigan Ave. It's easy walking distance to everything downtown. We got an unlimited L pass for three days. I flew into the airport this time and took the L to the hotel. We also used the L to get to the Sox games. For nightly enterainment, we either walked or took a taxi. I didn't see many families in this hotel, mostly business travel and adults. Everything in the hotel was clean and neat.

Reviews.Title: “We were stranded in Chicago on Memorial Day and got great service”
Reviews.Author: dim1964
Reviews.Content: My collegues and I (16 in total) were stuck in Chicago during Memorial Day weekend (late Sunday evening) due our flight cancellation. One of my collegues and I who were SPG members decided to call this hotel to see if they can accommodate our large group. Fortunately for us they had rooms for each of us so we grabbed taxis to the hotel (only 38 minutes from Chicago O Hare). The girl (I am so sorry I cannot remember her name) at the reception desk did a great job handling the reservations. Our rooms were clean and the hotel was quiet so we got enough rest to see Chicago (was my first visit to the city). We want to thank the receptionist and the staff for their kind service. Getting stuck in Chicago turned out to be a real treat for us.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & comfortable; friendly service with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: KiraBeauty
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 mites with 2 days at 98 degrees & 1 at 50 degrees and the hotel was really good. Only criticism- no AC in the enclosed pool area but that's being picky! All good & convenient to all the best places- so close to shopping, restaurants including Portillos, the Grill Room & the Chop House as well as Ginos & Due for pizza but we went to Lou Manatis which was AMAZING!!! we will remember the lovely reception staff the most!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and would absolutely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: tcrossen1966
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, comfortable and the staff were accommodating and very friendly. We were there for a conference and the air conditioning went out in our conference room. They IMMEDIATELY remedied the situation by moving us to another room and gave us a free night at the hotel for a later date. The location in excellent and within walking distance of many great restaurants and shopping opportunities. Without a doubt I will use this hotel again when I return to Chicago. I can't say enough good things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: tdijetta
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. We chose it based on positive reviews here and an amazing deal through Travelzoo. We paid $105/night + tax which INCLUDED PARKING!! Staff were all wonderful, from the doorman, to the check in staff. Check in staff graciously answered all of my questions about anything from accessing wi-fi to 'get us to the nearest pizza place.' We traveled with our 4 year old son so we were hoping the pool would be a nice diversion for him. It was GORGEOUS!!!! The best hotel pool I've ever seen - smallish but not bathtub-sized like so many are, and CLEAN. My husband and son swam in the pool 6 times in the 3 days we were there! Another great thing about this hotel is that it is right next door to a Trader Joe's - so I was able to at least get some fruit and healthy snacks to eat in between the pizza and hot dogs. The location of this hotel was absolutely perfect. Not too far north, not too far south, just right to hit all the Michigan Ave. shops. Room was very clean, beds were comfortable with nice duvets, not those shiny bedspreads you find in other places. Fancy toiletries, shiny bathroom. All in all, it was a GREAT place to stay!!! Free Wifi and free bottled water too! I know this is dependent on who your neighbors are but when we stayed it was extremely quiet too. YAY!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Property + Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: SeeSawSay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four points and it was my first time in Chicago. The location of this hotel is excellent and the staff were superb from the moment I arrived until I left. From greeting me by name, to offering great local advice, to recognizing me on sight and advising services and sights for touring, it was really a pleasure to have answers when I needed them. The front desk, the porters for bags, and the cleaning staff were all punctual and professional, thorough and prompt. I walked at all hours of the day and night, from 6 AM to 4 AM the next morning as I dealt with a new local schedule and meetings at unusual hours. The business center was a great resource and the staff were attentive and helpful - without being intrusive. Since I stayed for a few days, a breakfast on the premises would have been nnicer,m but there are many alternatives nearby and they are convenient, ample portions and reasonably priced from basic to extravagant meals. There are of course many restaurants for lunch and especially dinner also nearby the area within walking distance. Chicago was great and this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convenient as to why we came to Chicago to visit!”
Reviews.Author: Cincy2011
Reviews.Content: The staff at the reservations desk and the door attendant were very helpful. Our room was quite nice but a little dingy lighting wise. Two of the lights on the wall didn't have light bulbs so this presented the dinginess. Beds were comfortable. Liked the fact that we did have a refrigerator and microwave in the room but we did not really use these items, but it was nice to have them if needed. Of course, we did not like the fact that it cost us $80.00 in parking for the two nights we stayed there but I guess that most of the hotels charge for parking. I thought that I had arranged for a special package for the Amercian Girl but found out when checking in that I did not. I did appreciate the fact that coming in from the parking lot I dropped an empty small tote and when I checked the parking lot it was gone. I stopped by the front desk and found that some nice person found my tote and turned it in so I was greatly surprised and quite happy. We probably would stay at the 4 points again but I would make my reservations sooner and try to get a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect"”
Reviews.Author: Nejc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Chicago at the end of our route 66 adventure. So we were really happy that we pre booked this hotel for a nice and relaxed days in Chicago. Hotel is nice & clean and really almost on Magnificent mile. But that great position in downtown Chicago, cost you extra money... we payed extra 80$ for two days of parking our car. Hotel stuff are friendly & really quick. We check inn & out really in a couple of minutes. The only unpleasant thing was the position of our room. It was just over the hotel air - condition system and for that reason it was noisy. ut Chicago is noisy town otherwise. Really great place for sightseeing Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect from a Four Points”
Reviews.Author: Pezman2005
Reviews.Content: When you think Four Points by Sheraton you think you're getting one of the best around for your dollar, especially in downtown Chicago off 'the mile.' This Four Points is "nice" but nothing spectacular by any standards. The rooms look dated with the exception of the flat screen TV. They are dark and dingy unless you've got every light on in the room. The bathrooms are a piece of work; really need an update. The lobby is super small and always packed every time you walk through it. And the ladies at the front desk are short of polite. The only person who went above and beyond like most Four Points was Dante, the bell hop. He was exceptional. The rest of the staff could use a lesson from him. He literally ran down the street to fetch our large group a van taxi and didn't stop until he found it. Fantastic and polite gentleman. I booked the room via Hotels.com so I knew I wasn't going to see any SPG rewards on the stay but asked the ladies at the front desk if I could add my member card # irregardless for ammenities / parking expenses to earn points and it just seemed like such a hassle to them that they didn't even bother. Parking = $40/day. Yikes. But I guess that is pretty average. Would stay at again if I was in Chicago but not if I wanted to impress anyone exceptionally or expect to see Four Points type style/class. Free WiFi. No mini bars in room. Free bottles of water each day (2). Workout facility/pool onsite. Hope this helps. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: CocktailMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location downtown and, from what I can tell, a good bargain. (I had a convention rate of $99/night.) I can personally recommend the housekeeping staff -- I left a drawerful of stuff behind, by accident, and a staffperson cheerfully arranged to have it shipped promptly to my home, no charge. A big bonus - there's a Trader Joe's grocery store in the ground floor of the hotel, a great place to pick up snacks and drinks. (My room came equipped with a fridge and microwave; if I hadn't been there for a conference, I could've eaten very cheaply and relatively healthfully if needed.) The staff members that handled our conference meals and gatherings were attentive and professional. Only small negative, the downstairs lobby is small and tends to be crowded and noisy. (I was able to check in quickly, though.) Also, the elevators are slow; my advice: if you're fit, get a low floor and find the stairs. They're carpeted, and accessible with a key card, so I felt safe. The restaurant downstairs, eLeaven, was good and inexpensive - GREAT bagels.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerGal
Reviews.Content: We booked the Four Points through Hotwire and got a fantastic rate. We drove to Chicago but did not utilize their parking which was $40/day. Instead, I used Park Whiz to find a spot for the weekend that was a 10-15 min. walk from the hotel and it worked out perfectly. On our arrival, it was pouring rain. We decided to drop off our luggage at the hotel before we parked the car for the weekend. The staff was very accommodating and allowed us to park outside the hotel to check in and drop off the luggage. We checked in around noon and were assigned a room on the 6th floor. It was a very quiet floor, never heard a peep during the night. We had a king sized bed which was comfortable but the pillows were horribly flat. They could definitely improve on the quality of pillows. The location of the Four Points was fantastic. Very close to most tourist attractions - a 10-15 minute walk from Millenium Park and one street away from the Mag. Mile. It was also close to the subway and bus lines which made it a great home base for exploring the city. As mentioned in previous reviews, the Trader Joe's attached to the hotel was a great spot for picking up a few snacks, breakfast food and beer/wine. The free wifi was a bit inconsistent. We had problems logging in on the first night. A call to front desk produced an explanation that they had been having issues with it all day. The speed of the wifi also wasn't great but it was good enough to check a few emails from our room which was convenient. We used the hot tub and pool area and although not luxurious by any means, it was still nice to have a soak after a long day of walking. Our room included a small fridge and microwave which was good for storing a few cold drinks. The Four Points also offers one small complimentary bottle of water which was appreciated but we wished we could have had 2 bottles of water (one per person). We also liked that this hotel was 100% smoke free. We hope to return to Chicago again in the future and would definitely be interestd in staying at the Four Points.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: MissKatydid
Reviews.Content: Clean room, comfy bed, good value and GREAT location!

Reviews.Title: “Staff Extended Themselves to Assist”
Reviews.Author: MickieB45
Reviews.Content: We needed a last minute reservation to attend a funeral. The staff at the front desk and the maid staff went out of their way to get our room ready, to hold our luggage, to give us extra towels, to adjust our reservation, etc. Location turned out to be great. Wish it didn't cost so much to park the car.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location but my kindle was stolen.”
Reviews.Author: Jujucom1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this Hotel for business and the location was convenient and the rooms were pretty standard. They seemed to be understaffed when we checked in as there was only were person working at the desk to answer calls and check people in.The positives were that the free wifi and the fact that we were able to walk to our meetings The major negative was that I left my Kindle in the room and when I returned to the hotel that afternoon it was gone. Housekeeping had no trace of it and now I have to buy a new device. Amazon said that someone called to re register it but they were unable to. This was a disturbing experience would turn me off from returning to this hotel especially since there are so many option in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and service!!”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrs5
Reviews.Content: We were here for our 35th anniversary and were treated like a King and Queen. The staff was geniunely interested in showing us a good time. The hotel is beautiful, comfortable, and close to many attractions and restaurants. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Dollar for Dollar, one of the best hotels we've stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: canadians22
Reviews.Content: A big thank you to the front desk staff and one of the manager's for your assistance upon arriving at the hotel. We had a few minor issues which were taken care of immediately and with such professionalism. We are also very thankful of the extra attention given to our son! We cannot say enough about this hotel. It was so clean, staff was so courteous, the doormen were so helpful and our stay was wonderful. We highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to stay in a great location, easily accessible to some of the best shopping Chicago has to offer. The parking was also very convenient. Thanks again Four Points by Sheraton (downtown Chicago) for a great stay and we will be sure to visit again on our next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “All round excellence”
Reviews.Author: LondonGal35
Reviews.Content: I just got home after a 5 night trip from London, England. I was initially looking for a 4 star hotel but chose this one due to the good reviews - I was not disappointed! ALL the staff were always very friendly and accomadating. Although this is not an extravagant hotel, it was always very clean and appeared to be well maintained. The microwave and fridge in the room were clean and very handy. I had no problems with the wireless internet and being free was a bonus :-) The gym and pool aren't massive but they are adequate. It was nice to be able to grab breakfast right next door and the Trader Joe's was really handy as well. I LOVED the location - less than a minute to the Mile and with a few mins of lots of excellent restaurants and bars. Navy Pier and John Hancock centre are 10-15mins walk away. Whilst sightseeing I saw some of the other hotels that I had considered but, for me, the location of Four Points definitely made it a better choice. My room had a broken iron (which was quickly replaced) and a broken door handle to the balcony (I was still able to get in and out) but these were very minor things considering the other plus points to this very nice hotel :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: uniquecon
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, clean and in a great location. Close to lots of restaurants. And only one block off the mile. The only complaint I would have would be the beds were to hard for me but that is my personal preference. I would stay again. All the staff were very accommodating and friendly. Booked it through there site and got free parking at the same rate as the online booking places. They had free internet that is a big help, a little slow but it did the job. It also had a mini fridge, microwave and coffee pot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Great Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieBrownie
Reviews.Content: We found the Four Points on Travelzoo. We arrived at about 9 a.m. and our room was ready! What a wonderful surprise. The front desk personnel was friendly and went over and beyond to make us feel special. Great customer service!!!! The room was clean and the air conditioner/heater was quiet. The location was convenient and about 4 blocks from the Red Line trains. Shopping and restaurants were all within walking distance. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “We expected more, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Ringman1966
Reviews.Content: Although we had a wonderful time in Chicago and the location of the hotel was excellent, we were disappointed in the room itself. We were expected a much more luxurious room for $300 and this was more like a room at a cheap hotel, nothing fancy ANYWHERE in this place. Lobby is small, halls are mediocre, everything is just average or below in my opinion. We purchased the American Girl package and everything was just as stated, travel bed, cookies etc. That part of it was sweet and the lady at check in was very nice. We had the Double Extra Comfy room, but it was not all that comfy. The pull out was horrible, the sheets had not been changed and it was disgusting. After seeing that we were leery of everything else. They were kind enough to bring me a roll away since the mattress was obviously horrible and I injured my back trying to pull the darn thing out of the couch. I will give credit to the staff that came immediately after I called to complain and they tried their best to help us out. Some of the light bulbs were burnt out and the air conditioner was LOUD. There were no luggage carts which meant three trips down the the garage to get our stuff. One thing did work out in our favor....when I told the desk about our problems at check out they comped our parking which was a great savings so I appreciated that.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: frtwaynie
Reviews.Content: would definitely stay here again. just a block off Michigan, somewhat behind the crate and barrel. nice and clean and wonderfully quiet. we asked for a quiet room and got one on the inner courtyard, so no view, but it was incredibly quiet. Worked for us, but something to keep in mind if you'd rather see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: samax05
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel! It all started with an upgrade request that was dealt with promptly and with flexibility. The room was very comfortable except for a few minor issues which were addressed very quickly. The location is absolutely terrific! Close to everything and we were able to use the subway and transit system for our entire stay including the trip to and from the airport. The best part of this hotel was the very friendly and helpful staff from the front door to the front desk all the way to our room. We would go back there in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Dear Four Points Sheraton Chicago, my love for you is undying. Can't wait to visit you again and again!”
Reviews.Author: hannah_marie859
Reviews.Content: This is hands down one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had while traveling. The location, service and friendliness of staff, room quality, beds and value were nothing short of exemplary. I will take this hotel over the W or Westin anyday. I just returned from chicago this past Sunday and my husband and I are already working on a trip back! Love you Four Points Sheraton and I will highly recommend you to anyone I meet!

Reviews.Title: “feel welcome here”
Reviews.Author: Need2Travel4Fun
Reviews.Content: comfortable and great location . front desk very personable and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Perfect Chicago Hotel in Perfect Location and with Guests' Comfort in Mind”
Reviews.Author: FairmindedTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a belated but very well-deserved review. If you are looking at this hotel as a potential first-time guest, the breakdown (as of today) of the 300+ reviews says all you need to know -- 265 of 301 reviews give the top two ratings and only 12 of 301 give the bottom two dissatisfied ratings. That is unheard of in ANY business..heck if a fastfood restaurant were rated similarly by its customers, I bet more than 12 of 301 would be upset that their double-cheeseburgers didn't have pretty wrapping paper or arrive on fine china or had too many pickles or something like that. Another comforting factor (to you potential guests) is how hotel management graciously responds to and welcomes TripAdvisor feedback -- obviously they really care and it shows! I had a wonderful stay all the way around. Booked the hotel through a 3rd-party discount site which is technically opaque (you learn of the exact hotel after paying), but I'm one of "those" savvy travelers who can narrow down to within an 80-90% chance of what hotel I will receive (Priceline, Hotwire). When I knew I was likely to get the Sheraton Four Points, I jumped at the chance. The trip was part of my 2nd-ever venture to Chicago and 1st-ever trip to Wrigley Field (Opening Day no less!). Check-in was a breeze, got a room with two beds (convention/event had booked up all the one-bed rooms) on a higher-floor with some quiet as i requested, which was fine as I was traveling alone. Well-appointed room, nicer than most 3-star hotels -- extremely comfy beds (that's what you're there for, right), new flatscreen TV, microwave/refrigerator, complimentary bottled water, free highspeed internet (wired worked constantly and very fast -- wireless didn't work for me but no biggie as downtown concrete buildings can have occasional blind spots), and a very roomy (especially by Chicago standards) room. Further, the hotel's in a perfect location near lots of shopping and eateries near the Mag Mile, near transportation options (Chicago's bus system is exceptional, don't just do the subway/L), has an indoor pool/hottub in an enclosed courtyard (perfect if so-so weather and also private to the hotel) and a complimentary business center (great for travel adjustments, boarding passes, or web-browsing if you didn't bring a computer). From a customer-service standpoint, the staff from front desk/lobby to housekeeping all genuinely seemed to really care about guests and seemed to like each other and their jobs (always a pleasant and genuine "hello" or "do you need anything" in passing). I met the infamous Phillip, the doorman that everyone raved about in reviews, and true to form, he was going "the extra mile" for a guest when I said hello. If you're considering this hotel vs. others, ask yourself what's important to you -- to me, it's exceptional comfort, customer service, and many convenient free amenities in a tremendous location with a small-hotel feel. Personally, having stayed at the Intercontinental (a wonderful stay) and having the opportunity to stay at the Hyatt Regency or Palmer House Hilton for my next stay, I was like Pavlovs Dog to jump at the opportunity to again stay at my first and only Chicago choice, the Four Points Sheraton Magnificent Mile, in late April 2011. (Vegas was on the radar for the same dates, but Chicago at this hotel was the deciding factor!) In fact, when I knew that through my um "magical" travel-booking powers it would be possible, I changed my flight so I could spend 4 nights (instead of 3) at this absolutely wonderful hotel. Obviously I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good price.”
Reviews.Author: Luis_Tortajada
Reviews.Content: Its location allows you walking around the downtown, with a lot of possibilities (shopping, entertainment, cultural visits). The hotel has very good amenities that let you relax after a shopping day in the close "Magnificent Mile" or the daily cultural visti (swimming pool and gym, small but enough). To stay in Chicago for a reasonable price, perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A well organized, clean and friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Points Sheraton Chicago (Rush Street)during the last week in February. The hotel was well organized, clean and hosted a very friendly staff. Our room was comfortable, clean and well maintained. Additionally, the hotel's location lends itself well for shopping along Chicago's Magnificent Mile. Organized, clean, friendly and well located, add up to a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “The River Green”
Reviews.Author: Marisahcat
Reviews.Content: We try to get down to Chicago for the annual St Patricks Day Celebration when we can and this year we stayed at the Sheraton Four Points . We and the other 4 couples enjojed a great stay at this hotel. It was extremely pleasant and comforable and close to everything that is happpening in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: zadroj1
Reviews.Content: I booked the room at the last minute online and was not sure what to expect. I was surprised by the location, cleanliness and friendly staff at 4Points. I would definitely stay there again and recommend the hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Found a great value online”
Reviews.Author: anditos
Reviews.Content: We got a room for $41 / night through Hotwire and were very pleased (this was the first week of March so I imagine the same room goes for much more at other times in the year). The room itself was relatively basic - nice king bed, desk w/ internet connection, big tv w/ about 35 channels and a simple bathroom. For the price we paid, it was steal. Our only complaints were very minor and quite insignificant given the bargain price we were paying.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay-nice hotel, great amenities, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: SuburbMom_2
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to downtown Chicago (family of four with kids ages 8 & 10,) and we didn't know where to stay. So while I was hesitant to book a hotel based on online information and recommendations, the Four Points Sheraton really worked out great for us. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, business and family travelers alike. It had all of the amenities that were mentioned online-secure, attached parking garage, we could come and go with our car as often as we pleased (no valet.) The parking garage was well-lit and had elevators/doors directly into the hotel. We had a package deal that included parking, and I wasn't sure what to expect, and I was impressed. Our room was clean and had a fridge and microwave, which came in handy. The pool/hot tub area was clean, and our kids had a great time swimming even though the pool was only 3.5 feet deep. We didn't use the workout room, but it looked adequate and had more equipment than I would have expected. This hotel is in a great location. Michigan Avenue is only one block away. The area outside the hotel was well-lit and had heavy foot traffic. We did a lot of walking to and from Michigan Avenue and never felt unsafe. I also have to mention the staff. They were very, very helpful, nice and polite. I don't know if it was intentional, but they put our family in a room close to the pool. I really can't think of any drawbacks to this hotel. Maybe it wasn't as fancy as some hotels in the area down there, but the room wasn't drabby or outdated at all, either. Just a regular, nice hotel. We will definitely stay there the next time we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: pyw4411
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Four Points for a gymnastics meet that was being held on the Navey Pier. The location was perfect. The room was clean and well sized. The bottle of water was free, yes, free. The staff were helpful and friendly. The doormen were awesome. Not one complaint and would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: tommo007
Reviews.Content: After looking through trip advisor for a hotel in Chicago I plumped for this one, I don't want to blow my own trumpet but what a great pick. Everything about this hotel is 1st class the price the staff the rooms, the location if you want a great hotel don't bother looking anywhere else. This place is awesome

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff, and Great property. Looking forward to next time!”
Reviews.Author: sdivadknuj
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a third party. Having travelled to Chicago many time, but having never stayed at this property before I was somewaht hesitant as to what the experience would be like. I was very pleased with the staff and service that I received during my stay. I arrived on a Monday and departed on a Friday. Every day the staff was very attentive and accomodating to my needs - even during the blizzard when some staff had to work longer than expected they were still very pleasant and professional. The staff was very warm and welcoming. Rooms were roomy and well furnished. A place I would definitely like to return to in future trips to Chicago. Thank you Four Points staff for making my (an more importantly my clients') trip enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was alright but hardly a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cbeushausen
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was alright, but the room seemed kind of cramped and the bathroom was kinda small for what we paid! I loved the view of Downtown Chicago and the walking distance to everything including Navy Pier its just this hotel was alright for me! I think next time I stay in Chicago with my wife I will end of staying at a Hilton! This hotel just did nothing for me and there was no wow factor! The only thing that was good was the bed ! C'mon seriously update your hotel rooms for the price its not that hard!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy, good locale, nice choice for families”
Reviews.Author: brazilflyer333
Reviews.Content: We were left with a very good impression of this Four Points Sheraton property after four nights in January. Offers a great location just off Michigan Avenue and within easy walking distance to all of the best bars, clubs and tourist attractions of the downtown area. Fitness center was small but nice, the hot tub and pool were very good and seemed to be popular with families all day, every day. Front desk staff were very helpful with local directions and tips. While it offers some frills, others aren't available, like breakfast or a hotel restaurant. The hotel is connected by private doors to a very nice Japanese restaurant and local bakery/breakfast option. A Trader Joe's grocery and Starbucks are right next door. But because of all the hotel competition in this city, I certainly wouldn't recommend paying whatever the full price is that they're advertising here. Anything over $100 would be too much for me, based on the pros/cons here and other options along Michigan Ave. Front desk staff missed my early wakeup call one morning, which is normally a death blow for me and hotels. But the manager quickly contacted me that morning, apologized and offered a Starwood points bonus to compensate. I appreciated the gift, and the manager's effort. Overall, a very good choice, especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: DCary
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend for a Girl's Weekend in Chicago right after the blizzard. The front desk upgraded us to a "Comfortable" room when I mentioned their Facebook free upgrade offer. Wonderful location for exploring the city by foot or mass transit. Not fancy but very clean. They let us check in early and stored our bags the day we left. Highly recommend for a comfortable place to sleep when you will be gone most of the day. Was quiet at night. Free Wi-Fi in room.

Reviews.Title: “4 start service, 5 star location”
Reviews.Author: Verde55
Reviews.Content: The Four Points Sheraton is our first choice for a Chicago hotel. It might not have the large lobby and Mezanine, and multiplicity of high end (and very expensive ) restaurants as Chicago's 5 star hotels, but it is arguable one of the best locations in the city, just off Michigan Avenue, the rooms are spacious (ours even included a couch and coffee table, and the staff very friendly and welcoming. A sushi place is connected, as is a great and inexpensive breakfast and lunch place (Eleaven), and Trader Joe's is next door, Pizzaria Due across the street. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Sweetnsassy3578
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took the kids to Chicago fo the weekend for their birthdays. We stayed at the Four Points Sheraton downtown. The hotel was very clean and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location was great.. we were close to a lot of places that I wanted the kids to see. Would recommend this hotel for your next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: melongreen
Reviews.Content: For the location and price, you cannot find a better option. Staff are very professional and friendly - catering to all needs and not over-servicing like some high end hotels. Rooms are nice and well maintained. It's not a 5+ or anything super modern/fancy but the beds are super comfortable, as in all starwood properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with an even better location!”
Reviews.Author: heybud3
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I received an offer through Starwood for $75/night over the New Years Eve weekend. We weren't sure what we were doing for NYE until we got that amazing deal and having stayed in this fantastically located hotel for Lollapalooza for the last two years our decision was easily made!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, and service.”
Reviews.Author: bigbombsbilly
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful with directions, suggestions for restaurants, and what to see and do. Room was very clean and all of the hotel staff had a midwestern down-to-earth attitude that I appreciated. Classy without being snobby. Well located right off of Michigan Avenue. We had our car but walked everywhere and kept the car in the garage (great rate on parking as well). Just make sure you don't park on the second floor which is reserved for patrons of certain local businesses.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but exactly what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: Acatchyscreenname
Reviews.Content: I spent two days at the hotel in the middle of January and was very pleased. The staff was outstanding and I saw them handle a couple of challenging situations with other customers very effectively. The location is right off the Mile with a bevy of restaurants nearby. If you are cheap, like me, there is a Trader Joe's downstairs where you can buy everything you need. The room was quiet and comfortable. Free wireless was definitely a plus. Two blocks from a Red Line station. Will definitely consider staying here again

Reviews.Title: “great location, very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Delco63
Reviews.Content: Great location a block from the magnificent mile, microwave etc in room - with a supermarket next door. Walking distance from just about everything. The room itself was clean and comfortable, staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Four Points......Minor complaint but great stay”
Reviews.Author: brightis
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Four Points Sheraton on Thursday December 30th for a two night stay in Chicago. Upon arrival we were greeted with a smile by Bobby who gave us great directions for the parking as well as some tips on where to eat for the night. After parking Bobby met us back in the lobby and escorted us to our room which was 8424. Our room consisted of 2 double beds, sleeper sofa and then the micro/fridge. Once we entered the room we were greeted with a very odd smell, which Bobby noticed as well. We didn't alert the front desk about the odor until a few hours later. They were very understanding, professional and moved us to a new room (7344) on the 7th floor. I wasn't sure they were going to be able to move us because of the holiday weekend but it was not a problem. Our new room had no odor at all and was just as clean and well stocked as our first room. We did have to call down to housekeeping for an extra blanket which was brought to our room within 5 minutes. My husband and I are sometimes very hesistant to stay at unfamiliar hotels. The Four Points Sheraton did not disappoint us at all. Every employee that we encountered (front desk, housekeeping, valet) were very professional,and helpful. We would definately stay here again in the future. Michigan Avenue was about 2 blocks away and we were surrounded by great restaurants. We walked to Rainforest Cafe, Eggsperience, TGIFridays, Giordano's and the Gran Lux Cafe. The farthest walk was to the Rainforest Cafe. The Hancock Observatory was about a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: shel98
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is pretty standard, but at the prepaid price, it was an extraordinary value. The location is great - one block off Michigan Ave. There are many dining and shopping options within walking distance. Museums, Second City, and other attractions are only a short cab ride away. The hotel itself is clean. The rooms were comfortably sized. The bed was comfortable, but as others have mentioned, the pillows are terrible. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Parking is pricey, but that is true of most other hotels in the city. For the price, I will definitely look to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Take Notice of This Gem!”
Reviews.Author: francis54
Reviews.Content: Great location and home base one block from the Mag Mile. Loop only a 15 minute walk. Clean and comfortable rooms - and great staff & concierge service. Don't miss the E-leaven bakery just down the hall from the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: sunpeople1
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend before Christmas here and had a great time. The staff was great and the room was awesome. This was our second time we stayed here and the staff went out of their way to accomodate us. My wife asked for a specific room and view they gave us an even better one. We will be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable, clean, great value”
Reviews.Author: millierover
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical going into this because of the very reasonable price through TravelZoo ($75/night; $20/night parking), but it was great. Very clean, good service, comfy bed. The location is incredible--one block off Magnificent Mile in the River North area. Excellent shopping and restaurants within an easy walk. Loved the hassle-free self parking with drive in/out. Would definitely stay again even at higher rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: TravelLots38
Reviews.Content: This is a great location and reasonable rates. Although it does not have valet parking it has a parking garage that connects to the hotel and personally, I feel, in Chicago beware of valet. Those are the people that may break into your car Many valet services do not lock your car so it is better to choose your parking and park your own car. This hotel is close to great restaurants Lawry's accross the street Lux Cafe on the corner and a great Sushi place next door. The bonus is that there is a Trader Joes next to the hotel and access to the parking garage.. Awesome place!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: superdrew
Reviews.Content: This was a really great place to stay. The location is perfect, and the hot tub and pool were nice. The hot tub could use a little upgrading. I''d definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great week in a beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: TsRabbit
Reviews.Content: Always wanted to see Chicago. Stayed at Four Point by Sheraton, downtown/ Magnificent Mile. The hotel was in the perfect spot. It was walking distance to everything. We took the bus tours all over the city. We got to eat great food. Saw beautiful buildings. Went out on the ledge at the Willis Building ( Sears Tower). The tour took us to Oprah's studio and store. And my husband loved getting his picture taken in front of Wigleys Field.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: le8501
Reviews.Content: The title says it all, there was really nothign special about this hotel other than the location... Dont expect to be wooed. Decorations aren't really that great. The place was clean and the pool was great, but that really is about it. Be prepared, parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean, spacey rooms”
Reviews.Author: bmeek94
Reviews.Content: Location was very convenient to many attractions, shopping and restaurants. Staff was very friendly. Room was very large and clean. At times, it can be a bit noisy with people in hall or street noise. Not enough to deter a future stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: belizngirlie
Reviews.Content: I stay here with 3 other colleagues for a conference at the Hyatt off of Michigan Ave. It was the perfect spot! We got a super deal for flight and hotel ($300/person w/ 4 to a room). It was right down the street from the hustle and bustle of Michigan Ave near shopping and great dining. The room was a decent size for 4 (women) people sharing. I would definitely recommend it if you want to be near downtown Chicago but don't want to pay astronomical prices.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GREAT VIEW”
Reviews.Author: kdrollins
Reviews.Content: I traveled to this hotel with my husband (who was going for business) and my sister who I brought along to go shopping. This hotel was in a great location for shopping, visiting the Navy Pier and plenty of eating. We walked everywhere and had no trouble. The rooms were great and the eateries in the hotel were good too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, great location, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Four_Ball
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points Sheraton over Chicago Marathon weekend. For Chicago, it was the best priced place close to Michigan Avenue, so we decided to give it a shot. We were very pleased with the service, the location, and economy. The hotel was very clean, well-kept, and in overall very good condition. The pool, workout facilities, and rooftop patio were nice to have in a downtown hotel. Our only slight disappointment was with the sleep quality of the rooms - primarily, the pillows. I've never critiqued pillows before on a hotel review, but when it was a unanimous complaint amongst our group, it seems worthwhile to mention. They were very poor and a small hotel investment in new pillows for its rooms would've made this place unbeatable in its class. Will definitely consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: doublehippy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located one block from Michigan Avenue and within walking distance of most major attractions. The staff was friendly and the rooms kept clean. Trader Joe's around the corner....so grab something for breakfast or lunch, as the rooms have a fridge and microwave. Would definately stay again on my next trip to this fabulous city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Karkies
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here this past weekend. The front desk ladies were all very helpful, especially Patricia. They even let me do a late check out due to my flight schedule. The location can't be beat with a Starbucks around the corner and 2 blocks to the L train. The rooms could be a bit quieter (heard people in the hallway and cars outside), but I guess that's city living. FREE WiFi too! Definitely a great stay overall :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: kat-liz10
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel due to its location and we were not disappointed! It was our first time to Chicago and it was great being so central that we were able to walk everywhere without having to bother with buses/trains etc. Our room was very spacious and looked out onto the street but we didn't have much problem with the street noise at all. The room was clean but it did feel like it could do with a bit of an update. The staff were all very friendly, especially those on the door, I would have no hesitation staying here again as it was good value for money for such a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: girlluxe
Reviews.Content: The room was a decent size for a downtown hotel. We had a room with 2 double beds. The refrigerator was a plus. Hotel is only a couple blocks from the el and even closer to bus routes. Great restaurants are all around. Loved Pops champagne bar. Definitely worth it if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PRJ01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location close to Michigan Ave. The staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel is very clean and the rooms well maintained. Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “hard work at times”
Reviews.Author: cecilette
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. We stayed 6 nights in room 6256 (â€˜extra comfyâ€™) and overall it was OK. **** The good points: 1) The room was very spacious, beds are really comfy and sheets very good quality. TV is amazing; there is also an empty fridge which is convenient for baby food and drinks. 2) staff: although clearly under economic pressure, they are all very polite and try to help most of the time. 3) location: simply amazing. Lots of shopping and restaurants around. We had several meals at California Pizza Kitchen and also Silver Spoon, both just outside the hotel. The hotelâ€™s own Japanese restaurant is quite nice as well but a tad more expensive. 4) the gym is good says the husband. 5) There is a washing machine and a drier on 8th floor ($1 each). 6) we were allowed to checkout slightly later and it was really helpful. **** The bad points: 1) Breakfast: There was no indication, at the time I booked ("best rate with breakfast"), that breakfast was not onsite. This hotel does not have its own breakfast room. They just give you a mean $10 voucher per person to go to a local deli. We complained to the manager that this web practice was border illegal. 2) Pool: The pool is terribly cold and they use far too much bleach. The jacuzzi (as they call it â€œthe Spaâ€�) is shabby. 3) Room: On arrival they first tried to allocate us a horrible room on 8th floor and we asked to change. I am glad we did. Then we had to call to get many basic things: robes, towels, proper glasses, sheets for the sofa, water bottles, hangers, and so on. Windows are not sound proof and the noise from outside is a problem. The air conditioning is too old - working well but quite noisy. Furniture falls into pieces (the front bit of the desk). Carpets are disgusting. My son walked 10 minutes in the room, and his socks had turned black. The room was never done before 1:00pm. It was really annoying. Room service should accommodate the guests needs, not the contrary. The room was never replenished â€“ we had to phone every single day to get new toiletries, coffee, water etc. What a hassle. What prevails is the sense that the hotel tries to cut the corners in every possible way; it is quite tiring to always have to ask for things. Having said that we had a very good holiday overall because Chicago has got so much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Adequate”
Reviews.Author: bognorjack
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 4 nights at the hotel. Very pleasant without being special. For us the location was better than the other Sheraton, right by the main shops etc, One minus, no in room safe. they had safety deposit boxes for which we were grateful, however you had to remove any items on the front desk, no privacy or seperate room.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mltuomisto
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! All the staff are very helpful and welcoming and always greet you with a friendly smile no matter how busy they are. The hotel is located within walking distance to lots of shopping, restaurants and attractions (we walked everywhere, including Navy Pier during a heat alert!!). It's got great security, free wi-fi, iHome clock radio, 24 hour fitness centre, business centre, pool and terrace on the 5th floor. The room was big and clean with nice amenities in the bathroom. Loved it and will definitely be back!! Thanks to all the staff who made our stay so great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: sfpaddy
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend in Chicago and stayed at the Four Points off Michigan Avenue. This is definitely not the cheapest hotel in town, but I can honestly say I have never been greeted by more happy, friendly staff in any hotel I have ever been to. This hotel is clean, excellently located for all sorts of out of town visitors and is safe. I read a couple of the negative reviews here.....all I can say is keep in mind, it's a Four Points and know what you're booking. If your reservation doesn't say breakfast included, it wont be included. If you want a 5 Star Spa Weekend, find a 5 star hotel with a spa! This is an excellent hotel for anyone who wants to drop their luggage and get out and explore Chicago. Perfect for anyone looking to spend hours on Michigan Ave and not have far to walk with all their shopping bags. Very convenient to a handful of decent local restaurants and there's a Starbucks on the block around the corner. If you have one too many deep dish pizzas a Uno's around the corner, spend a few minutes on the treadmill and you'll feel a whole lot better about yourself! I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cathy_collins
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, the staff was friendly and completely accomodating. It was our first visit to chicago and all the staff were more than helpful and made us feel comfortable. The room was clean, comfortable with a nice balcony, the pool was clean and warm a little on the small side but we didn't spend much time inside. The location was wonderful walking distance to anything we wanted to do shopping, restaurants, navy pier and Trader Joes was right next door so we were able to stock the room with food and beverages when we didn't want to go to a restaurant, we had a small fridge and microwave right in the room which made it so much easier. Highly reccomend staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Grubby and very unpleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: PeterCanterbury
Reviews.Content: Reading other reviews on this site and having just returned from a business trip to Chicago, with the complete misfortune of staying here, I felt I had to write in. I am still incredulous that I paid ~$275 after tax for a single room in what I can only describe as a complete let down of a hotel. Ironically my cab dropped me at the Sheraton Chicago Towers before this place, but realised they had not taken me to the Four Points. What a shame that that mistake was realised byt he cab driver (as I had got to the lobby of the Sheraton Chicago Towers and that looked one hell of a lot better). My room was very plain indeed, and had that distinct feeling of uncleanliness. Nylon duvet cover and lying in bed I got that kind of itchy feeling you get from a bed that isn't really clean. Air conditioner in my room was the size of a fridge and unsurprisingly was really noisy throughout the night. Came down for breakfast to find out hotel doen't have a breakfast room, but shows guests through to a very poor diner immediately next door. My friends travelling with me had cooked breakfast which was greasy and even made me feel ill (and I wasn't eating it). Could not wait to get out of this place and stay somewhere clean and less depressing. Taking a walk down the corridors is not a walk that fills you with optimism about the room waiting for you at the other end. I simply can't believe the other reviews for this hotel, I've stayed in many places, good and bad and I certainly know which end of the scale this one is. I was travelling with 3 other colleagues and they all had a similar view - breakfast the following morning was one of shared hoorro stories. Paying $275 for the privelege (without breakfast) is unbelievable. I can get a very nice hotel room in practically any city in the world for that, and the ugly and distinctly grubby room and public areas in this hotel do not warrant that kind of money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: thoakley
Reviews.Content: The location is great. You are only a block from Michigan Avenue and very close to restaurants. The staff are very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service & perfect location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lchilds72
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here this year, & again, my stay was impecable. From Barbara at the desk, to housekeeping for extra pillows, to the doorman.... all of the employees appeared to enjoy their job, & their level of service reflected that. My room had a nice city view. Bed was comfortable. Fridge/microwave/coffee pot in room was great. Just one block off the heart of the Mag Mile, and near great resturants all around, this is the perfect location in downtown. Trader joes & starbx are just next to hotel. Grande Lux Cafe is across the street & a great resturant find. Make 4 points your choice in downtown Chicago! I'm glad I did!

Reviews.Title: “No need to look for any place else to stay when in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: HeyJude55
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Four Points Sheraton, and now that I have found this wonderful hotel it is where I will stay when in Chicago. We arrived around 11:00, and not only was a room ready for us, but we were upgraded! What a great way to start our visit to Chicago! Jenise at the front desk was so very personable and suggested Grand Lux for our lunch - we were not disappointed in that choice! She also offered us maps and explained the ammenities in the hotel. Every time we came back to the hotel during our stay, we were greeted with a friendly hello and asked how our day was. We purchased tickets for the Architectural boat tour right at the front desk, and were also given a coupon for $10 off at Dos Diablos, which is a great Mexican restaurant nearby. The room was very clean, and when we called to request extra towels and pillows, they arrived in less than 10 minutes. As many have said, the location of the hotel could not be better. We were a nice walk or a short cab ride from everywhere we wanted to go. I am sure there are fancier hotels, but for a girls' trip to Chicago, this place fit the bill perfectly. I must say that our favorite part of the stay was the friendliness of the staff - a big shout out to Frances and Jenise - you gals are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Something bad turned into something good”
Reviews.Author: Chellpooh
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Four Points and when I arrived I was suprised at how easy it was to find with it being surronded by so many other buildings. When I walked into the lobby I was amazed by the decor and how beautiful it was. But when I went to check in my room was checked out to someone else. But the staff was really good and accomdated our needs so well that I am willing to make this hotel my permanent hotel for all my downtown weekend stays. I am now planning another weekend trip downtown Chicago and this time with the family so we can enjoy all the special amenities the hotel has to offer. Thank you for making my weekend get away an enjoyable one. Great job!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location!”
Reviews.Author: bassin_1975
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago on a baseball park tour and it also happened to be our 10th wedding anniversary. We stayed 2 nights and it was a great stay. Don't have one negative thing to say. The service was great, can't think the ladies at the front desk enough for all their recommendations and help. We also ordered room service and was very pleased with the food and nice lady who brought it to us. Very friendly. This is hotel is walking distance to most things downtown..great time!

Reviews.Title: “5 isn't good enough for this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KevKevUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in. From the moment you walk in you are made to feel special. We were welcomed by a very informative and friendly member of staff at front desk and provided with maps and local area information. Our room was located on the top floor; which required a room key to access; making our room feel much more secure. The room was huge and the bathroom was again a very comfortable size. Free bottles of water were provided on a daily basis, along with a daily maid service and coffee (Seattle's Best brand) again offered daily. Towels / Bedding could be changed daily unless you chose not to. The TV had all the major channels you would expect; though during our trip the weather channel was the main one watched. The beds very large and very comfortable - offering a great nights sleep. Oddly enough the one thing missing from the room that I did expect was a safe to keep our valuables in. There was an ethernet connection; and free high speed wireless internet avaliable, and my iPad had no issues connecting to it. In addition there was a business center that allowed me to print my boarding cards for the return journey, very useful. The swimming pool on the 4th floor was not the biggest but perfect for a quick cool down after a busy day before heading out at night, and the whirlpool provided extra relaxation. The pool was open until 10pm daily, so plenty of time to use it. There was also an outside sun deck, and a gym - we didn't use these, but it was a nice extra to have. On exit and entry, unless a member of staff was busy assisting a customer we were always greeted, and the doorman was additionally helpful in informing us of taxi prices and storing our luggage on the last day. The hotel was one block from the mile, and two from a red line station; making it a very good place to use as a base as the red line is 24 hours. The Loop was a 15 minute walk, or a 5 minute red line trip. Overall this hotel is beyond fantastic in my opinion and I would not hesitate to return. A rating of 5 in my opinion isn't enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - excellent room - extra comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: SherriB1050
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for vacation. Very pleased. Excellent location. Microwave and refrigerator in room so with Trader Joe's next door able to keep breakfast in room and snacks. Maids were very nice and didn't bother us when we didn't leave one morning until noon. Everyone was very courteous and knowledgeable. Great location. Quiet. The bed was extremely comfortable. Bathroom good size - and seating area nice to have the extra space. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great price”
Reviews.Author: JuneWard
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we've stayed here and we'd go back in a minute. Location is great for shopping on the Mag Mile, and we walked to the Grand Ave Red Line Station to catch the "L" to go to a Cubs game at Wrigley Field. That was such an easy and inexpensive way to get to the game. The hotel was very clean, the beds comfortable, it was quiet. Close to Grande Luxe restaurant, a short walk across Michigan Ave and Erie to go to a Corner Bakery for breakfast. Plenty of places around to eat. It also has a nice 3' 6" pool to cool off in and a terrace to relax on outside the pool. A bargain for any visitor to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts of home---”
Reviews.Author: bovine44
Reviews.Content: To have a Trader Joe's around the corner from your hotel knowing that a frig and microwave await you in your room makes the stay so much more relaxing. You can either snack in your room or walk across the street for a decent pizza at Pizzeria Uno/Duo. Michigan Ave just three blocks away and the trains just four blocks away makes the location ideal. Staff is accomodating, front desk pleasant and helpful, rooms absolutely spotless. Easy and efficient climate control in rooms. Did not try restaurant - did get busy in evening - so can't be all bad. Internet service spotty and unreliable - probably because of traffic

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Deal just off the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: cmitchb
Reviews.Content: Located a block from Michigan Avenue, this hotel has all you need if you're in Chicago to see the sights and run the streets. It's ridiculously close to everything downtown. The room was basic Sheraton style, the staff was extreemly pleasant and the rate was just right. There's a sushi resaurant adjacent to the hotel as well as a grocery store. Lawry's steak house is right across the street and has a great lunch special. The only drawback - parking was $38 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MadisonGirl66
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two teenaged children June 9-11. One of the reasons I chose this property was because it had a pool and upgrades were to be completed two days before our stay ... on our day of arrival, a notice on the pool door said the pool was closed and would open the day we were leaving! When I (nicely) mentioned my disappoint to the front desk staff, while inquiring about a roll-a-way, the front desk staff apologized and immediately said, "How about if we upgraded your room to a suite with a sofa sleeper?" The folks here have fantastic customer service! They were helpful, accommodating, always said "hello"; basically, they were awesome! Parking was only $38.00 per night. The location was fantastic in relationship to Michigan Ave, Navy Pier, great restaurants, horse drawn carriage rides ... even Grant and Millenium Parks (if you like walking, which we do!) The room was a little smallish (and the sofa sleeper mattress wasn't that bad!) but really clean with great housekeeping. There is a restaurant (for breakfast and lunch). Menu is fairly varied and prices are typical, yet reasonable for Chicago. Also, I was given a great room rate from their "Birth Year Rate" special, which ended up being $133.00 per night (including tax)!! I will absolutely come back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: MariaLodz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a leisure trip to the city. Check in was quick and efficient with a friendly. The room was clean, but not modern. Room overlooked the shopping centre opposite. The location was great, about a one minute walk from Magnificient Mile. I did not eat at the restaurant at night so canâ€™t comment on that. Nice stay but not perfect. Typical 3/4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and comfort”
Reviews.Author: globaloutlook
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night over the Memorial day. Location was a breeze to find via car. Parking was attached to the hotel and was 38.00 for a.m the first day to 6 p.m the next. A bargain for downtown Chicago. The hotel is conveniently located so we could walk to restaurants, shopping, museums, galleries etc.. The room was clean, spacious and well appointed. The bed was wonderful. As a starpoint member we were given a room on the top floor with a balcony and view of the city.The service at the hotel was efficient and helpful. Trader Joe 's is right around the corner- since the room had a microwave and fridge we bought our own breakfast items.The hotel restaurant is ridiculously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Friendly Service and Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: EverydayMomof1
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate through HotWire on the FourStar. When we arrived in toddler in toe we were upgraded to a king suite, the suite was basically a king bed with open living area which included a pull out sofa bed. This was perfect for us. The Room was very clean, comfortable and quiet. The pool was closed but they had arranged for their patrons to use the Marriots pool a block down. The location was perfect with a bakery and a Trader Joe's within the building. We parked the car and walked everywhere for the 2 days we were there. We had a wonderful time and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsbucket91905
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March of 2008 and again on this Memorial Day weekend trip. It's a very nice hotel, clean, nice rooms, and very friendly staff. It's in a great location for everything we wanted to get to. Nice to have complimentary bottles of water as well. We'll be back to stay here again while in Chicago!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: astatine7
Reviews.Content: It's been a year since I stayed here but I wouldn't hesitate to go back. The location was excellent for shopping, sightseeing. However, depending on heavy your luggage is it's not the easiest to get to from O'Hare international. It involves changing lines and they don't really have escalators on their subway system. This is however better than getting of at 'Chicago - Blue' and walking. It's a long walk! Everything about the hotel was wonderful. The concierge in particular was a such a lovely helpful guy. You should speak to him if you want tickets to something (I got told off when he found we had bought tickets for a comedy show and they would have been cheaper from him) It's in a fantastic location for shopping and the Pier. I would definitely recommend it! The room was huge - two double beds. The bathroom was always clean and we had not problems with the water. We didn't order room service or have food within the hotel but that was because we had always eaten so much during the day. There are so many restaurants around, that it's much more dun to try those.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: leutje
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Four Points by Sheraton/Chicago was wonderfull. We had a room on the 8th floor, it was big, very comfortable beds, we had no noise ( not from the hall, not from outside). The staff, and I mean everyone, was very friendly, very nice and very helpfull. Every day we got a free newspaper (USA today), free water, free use of microwave, coffeemachine, iron, tv, etc...... Its is a excellent hotel and would recommend it to everyone. The location is near everything, a minute walk to the magnificent mile, 10 minutes to the navy pier; etc I would defenetly come back.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: jamieb27
Reviews.Content: My bestfriend and I stayed here for my birthday weekend the hotel is in a great location; the staff here is one of a kind &warm the whole stay. I would stay at the four points again our stay at the four points was great!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good staff, no hassles”
Reviews.Author: balletcat
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on Expedia at the beginning of February and paid $300 for four nights in a king room. This was well worth it given the comfortable room, nice clean bathroom and location walking distance from the Loop and next to the Magnificent Mile. Pros: Friendly and helpful staff, rooms well equipped (fridge, iron, hairdryer, robe, coffee maker, free internet (and free boarding pass printing)), eating options nearby Cons: Our room was far from the elevators and happened to have an air vent just outside which was permanently on and making a noise. Not enough to disturb sleep but enough to be annoying (as if someone had left the fan on in the bathroom). The towels were also really small and thin, strange considering everything else was pretty nice and new. It's not a beautiful historic hotel, and our window had no view, but at the price we paid no complaints! Housekeeping came round quite early in the morning knocking on doors and calling "Housekeeping!" but they respect the Do Not Disturb signs, you just have to remember to put the sign out each night. Despite our slow morning starts the room was always done by the time we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Annual_Traveler06
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 10:30am with the expectation that we'd have to valet our bags until check-in, however, our room was ready and we were upgraded to a king suite. The front desk was very helpful at check-in, asking us what we had planned, then provided with us with coupons for shopping and food. The free Wi-Fi was fast and easy to connect. It was very convenient to map out restaurants and museums, and access email. You could not ask for a better location. It's just a short walk from an "L" station and 1 street away from the 600 block of Michigan Ave. There's shopping, restaurants, and public transportation all around. Our bed was comfortable and the room was spacious. We will not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Iamatrip
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Four Points on North Rush April 8-11. The friendly service extended from the Door Man at the front, right through the reception desk and included the Housekeeping staff. The location was perfect and there is a great little restaurant connected to the hotel called e.leaven. Delicious blueberry muffins and breakfast. We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at Best”
Reviews.Author: meier5
Reviews.Content: Traveling with friends for shopping and a show. The location is Great, but that is the best I can say. The rooms are very average, hallway carpet is stained and buckled in many places. Couch and carpet in the room were also both stained. We had 2 rooms each with 2 people. One room had one nice fluffy robe and a throw, the other room had none. Upon leaving we called 10 minutes ahead ahead for our car, as instructed. We came down, the bell man asked if we needed a cab, we told him we were waiting for our car. we waited 20 minutes, with him standing right there at the bell stand, then he disappeared. we went inside to ask and the receptionist told us she forget to tell him to get it, and he was busy, so we would have to wait. She apologized, we waited another 20 minutes, the manager asked if we were being helped, we explained our situation at which point the bell man came up and said he was busy and very rudely told us he would go get and was mumbling about us as he left-very bad customer service-given it was their mistake. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, attached indoor self parking”
Reviews.Author: IULynn
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this Four Points in March. It was very conveniently located. Close to shopping and restaurants. E'leaven Bakery is attached to the hotel. It had a very delicious and affordable breakfast. We got a great rate on Travelzoo that included self parking. Parking garage is enclosed and attached to the hotel. We were able to leave our car in the garage until 6 pm on the day we checked out which was very convenient. We left our bags in our car after we checked out and were still able to do more shopping. Rooms are spacious and clean. They have a small workout room with treadmills, ellipticals and exercise bikes.

Reviews.Title: “Great on every aspects !”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMaire
Reviews.Content: Last week was our first trip to Chicago and I had booked this hotel based on the great reviews I had read on this website. I was not disappointed at all ! Everyone working there was nice, smiling and polite, each time I asked for infos I was served perfectly. The room was clean, so was the bathroom and for tourists like us, the location was exactly what we needed : 30 seconds walk from the Mile, walking distance from the John Hancock Building, from the Navy Pier and from the River and if you hate to walk, there are many buses that stop on the corner of Ontario and Michigan ... When I'll go back to Chicago, as I really loved this city, this hotel will be my choice again !

Reviews.Title: “MY NEW FAVORITE CHICAGO HOTEL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cop38002
Reviews.Content: From the staff to the amenities--this place is top notch! We visit Chicago about 3 times per year and have stayed in a multitude of hotels....we will be back to this Hotel from now on! The staff was extremely helpful and nice! The doorman, Phillip, is top notch! He is very professional, curteous and always greeted us with a smile! The room was spacious and had teh added bonus of a microwave and fridge--perfect for the yummy leftovers! There was also complimentary botteled water everyday in our room--something you don't see anymore! Combine all of this with an ideal location in Chicago and you just can not beat this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bleujean
Reviews.Content: My husband, 20 year old daughter and I went to Chicago and this was my first time there. Four Points was a wonderful place to stay. It is one block off Magnificent Mile, centrally located to just about everything. Everyone from the doorman, check in counter and housekeeping were were wonderful and very helpful. The room we had was nice size and clean. It was a double with a pull out sleeper sofa. The beds were comfortable, the only thing I would change are the pillows, they are very soft and flatten down. But that is my personal preference. I can't wait to go back! Thank you Four Points for making our visit so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful all the way around”
Reviews.Author: debnus
Reviews.Content: I am always a little worried when we travel with our children. I booked this hotel specifically because it has an indoor pool, refrigerator in the room, microwave, and laundry facility in the hotel itself. I called several times before we arrived for a variety of reasons: double check that we could leave our bags if rooms weren't ready when we got there, that our two rooms were adjoining, and to request a crib for our baby. Each of the requests were fielded easily and we got everything we needed. Upon arrival we found the staff absolutely helpful and pleasant to work with. The doormen especially were outstanding. My mother and mother in-law took the kiddos around the city each day while my husband and I were at our conference and they checked in each morning to confirm directions to the CTA stops they needed. . . each time they were treated with respect. My children were greeted with high fives and questions about their adventures each time we came or left. ABSOLUTELY made their trip. The location of the hotel is quite nice. Just off the mag mile and above a supermarket and coffee shop. Restaurants are close and the CTA stops were literally two blocks away in any direction. The rooms were comfortable, if a little worn. There were stains on the carpet which we noticed after being there for a little bit, but we were there with the kiddos, so it was a little comforting. The beds were just fine and we felt pampered the whole time we were there. Safe, secure, and the rate we got was wonderful. I especially like that you don't have to pay for internet or the bottled water :)

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Pleasant but beginning to get run down”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place. Plenty of positives and the value is well worth it, as well as the location. The doorman is beyond excellent. The staff is oh kay yet maybe a bit forgetful. I asked for the toilet to stop running for two days and it still isn't fixed. The rooms are oh kay. They are clean, but it is odd to have a wall-mounted air/heater on a hotel only 4 years old, and to not have flat screen tv's. The bedding is oh kay, pillows are beyond lackluster. I have a neck ache from the past 2 nites of sleeping and trying to get comfy. Bathroom is simple and clean. Very small lobby typical of a limited service hotel, but a great pool area that is huge. This is at the expensive of having the most ridiculously small gym I have ever seen for a hotel this size. This place is worth it due to the proximity and value pricewise. good choice all around, but don't expect anything spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Tuzzanna
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here in the past but have been very disappointed this stay. We had a group block that was to have 2 beds per room or 2 beds with a pullout. We were given 1 bed and pulls outs or handicap rooms. We had a contract that stated double beds but was told we got what they had. Was also told that if I choseto take my group elsewhere I would be charged for all rooms. The reason we came bakc was the customer service in the past was GREAT!!!! What happened??

Reviews.Title: “a good time”
Reviews.Author: letsgo5054
Reviews.Content: came into chi for auto show a little shoping and dinner. this hotel is a perfect location for what we wanted to do. a block off michigan ave and in the middle of lots of restraunts[across street from lawrys prim rib.] from the time i pulled up to the hotel all went well. the front dest was very accomadating from parking to directions.had a great price with travel zoo that included parking.had a great time and will stay at the four points again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Chicago hotel for price and location”
Reviews.Author: solring
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel to a slight mixup which was taken care of immediately and we were given a room upgrade. Hotel location is excellent right in the middle of chicago-nma. Restaurants and shopping close by in walking distance. excellent stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great value”
Reviews.Author: JonM80
Reviews.Content: Paid $90 for the night on hotwire. Its your typical 3 star hotel. Room was clean, a bit small. Hotels in downtown Chicago can get pricey so if you can get this hotel for under $100 I think you're getting an awesome price.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the time”
Reviews.Author: Milwaukee_Hotel
